texts.en: Mwanasha is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her sister's siblings. She has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy bags of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mwaboso

texts.en:
Mwaboso is married and has five children. Two of his children are in school and the rest are still underaged. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one and a half years he has operated a motorcycle business. He faces a major challenge of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. He dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing himself.

With the loan of ksh.50,000, he wants to purchase a new motor bike. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor bike

loans.name: Ropia

texts.en: Ropia lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 37 years old and married with five children. Four of his children go to school. The youngest is two years old and has yet to start going to school. In Mombasa he has been running a retail business for five years now. He has two employees who run the business since Ropia is employed and is not on the premises to manage it properly. In five years' time, he plans to open two more branches of his business. The main challenge that he faces is losses. He found out about Milango through friends and is now seeking a loan to buy wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour for his business. The extra income he raises will pay his children's school fees and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren, 34, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last 12 years Saren has been farming rice. The current business earns her about 14,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet her family’s needs.

Saren has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizers for farmland. She hopes this loan will enable to grow her rice paddy so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland

loans.name: Sokmean's Group

texts.en: Sokmean is a mother of two children, one who is too young for schooling and one schoolchild. To deal with her daily cost of living, she farms rice whereas her husband drives a motor-taxi. The current business that she has had for six years provides her about 16,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sokmean and her co-borrower are fifth-time borrowers. Sokmean is the group leader. Sokmean has repaid her past loan wisely to imrpove her living standard in a good pace. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Age 60 years old, Mao is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children. She earns a living through farming rice and growing oranges which she had been doing for ten years. She and her husband can earn about 40,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day from the current business and are able to save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Mao has only been with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. Mao is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is applying for a loan of $1,200 USD to improve her business. She is married and she is running a business in the market by selling bags, short sleeves and long sleeves shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes, and slippers. She is making a good income from selling bags, short sleeves and long sleeves shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes and slippers and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

She is living in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her store a year ago with her working capital of $600.00, and she is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people and she can improve her living conditions for the future.  She lives in a house that is very simple and also has animals like goats, pigs, and buffalo.  In addition she also has a garden which offers much food.  Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy bags, short sleeves and long sleeves shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes, and slippers

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, age 33, is a married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Her husband is working as a laborer in a firm but his earnings were so poor, she started tailoring at her home. She has been doing this for the past 5 years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She also deals in the business of clothes sales to generate extra income. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to pay for personal expenses.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Parveen raises her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: to buy stitching machine for sewing cloths

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, is a 30-year-old married woman, and lives with her husband and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about 8 years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Her husband enjoys his work, because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings. Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has a regular income and has more free time. This will be her 1st loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with your cooperation her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time.

Fouzia requested a sum of 25,000 PKR so that her husband will be able to buy the body of an auto rickshaw.

Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this honor.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry es un pequeño productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su pequeña finca donde cultiva principalmente café. Ha tenido 3 préstamos con la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) los cuales ha cancelado debidamente. La cosecha de café de Henry el último ciclo fue de 80 quintales de café pergamino. Para este ciclo, además de trabajar fuerte, él confía que con el préstamo que está solicitando para atender adecuadamente su café con insumos, fertilizantes y labores culturales, va a mejorar los rendimientos y por tanto sus ingresos. Para este pequeño productor, el abono y el foleo son clave para el desarrollo de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Henry is a small coffee producer from the northern part of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and four children on a small farm where he grows primarily coffee. Henry has received three loans from the Association for People in Community Action (PAC) and all of them were repaid on time. His coffee harvest from the last crop cycle resulted in 80 quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of coffee beans in parchment.

In addition to working hard during this crop cycle, Henry is confident that the loan he requested can help him provide adequate maintenance for his coffee crop. He plans to buy supplies and fertilizers, as well as pay for labor. This will improve his yield and his earnings. For this small producer, compost and foliar plant food are the keys to developing his crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and pay for labor to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.ru:
Иномджон молодой, жизнерадостный  мужчина .  Он женат и  имеет 2 детей. Он  занимается  откормом скота. Его жена домохозяйка но она в свободное время помогает мужу   в развитии бизнеса. Раньше родители  Иномджона занимались этим бизнесом, теперь получив хороший опыт он сам занимается откормом скота.  От этого он имеет, молоко мясо и  не плохую прибыль.
Иномджон хочет получить кредит для покупки скота, потому что сейчас скот дешевле и хорошо содержать, так как есть везде трава и разные кормовые культуры. Он очень надеется, что Арванд  поддержит его бизнес так как многие фермеры уже получив поддержку от Арванд осуществили свои планы.
texts.en: Inomjon is a young debonair man. He has a wife and two children. He is starting to raise cattle. His wife is a homemaker but she has some free time to help her husband develop his business. Earlier, Inomjon's parents were in the business, so now he has good experience in fattening cattle. From this work he makes milk and butter which provides a good profit. Inomjon wants to get a loan to buy cattle, because now they are cheaper and will grow well, since there are many types of grasses and much to forage. He is very hopeful, that Arvand will support his business, as many farmers have already received support from Arvand and implemented business plans.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rechard

texts.en:
Richard is 27 years old. He is married and resides with his family in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has a two-year old son. He has been employed as driver for a church for over a year, earning approximately $5 daily. His wife is a tailor who makes an income of $2 per day. Richard wants to be employed in an international organization. To achieve this goal, he needs to complete his degree. Therefore, Richard requests a loan of $480 to pay for his tuition fees for his third year of Management studies. 

This loan will help him pursue his studies despite the financial crisis of his family. In addition, he hopes that he will get a high paying job when he finishes his degree in order to provide a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees for his third year of Management studies

loans.name: 1 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE ABRIL”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teófila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cargadores de celulares, venta de tostados, venta de frutas, venta de pasankallas, venta de verduras, venta de jugos de naranjas, tejido de busos de lana, costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teófila es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió cuando ayudaba a su madre al negocio familiar posteriormente decide establecer su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra una señora porque se fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “1 de Abril” (April 1st) is starting its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Teófila as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling reloadable mobile phone minutes, selling roasted corn, selling fruits, selling sweetened popcorn, selling vegetables, selling orange juice, knitting sweaters, and sewing.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Teófila. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from her friends from the group who are also members. In addition, a promoter from the organization came to her house to visit. Teófila currently has a business selling condiments. She learned about this line of work by helping her mother run the family business. Afterwards she decided to establish her own independent business.

The loan she is receiving now will increase her capital for buying condiments, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell these products from her vending stall. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family. Teófila is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Teófila said that she enjoys the loans and the health services. In the photograph, one woman is not present because she had a doctor’s appointment.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es: Doña María de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, es una mujer  muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar. Doña maría desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su hogar,  es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: María is 48 and lives in her own home with her family. She is a very responsible individual whose main priority is to support her family. She has a business selling tortillas, which she makes every day at midday and night. Her business is located in her home. María would really like to improve her business, since it provides her with a stable income, which allows her to support her family. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy corn and lime powder, to make more tortillas, especially at weekends when demand is high because many other tortilla stands are closed. In this way, she will be able to boost her earnings, which will in turn enable her to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Moussabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Mama 1ère  femme debout à partir de la gauche est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Moussabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi 2 group are all married and live in traditional families. They have an average age of 31, and have on average two children each. The live in the village of Moussabougou in the Ségou region (Mali’s fourth-largest administrative region), and know each other through their winter agricultural businesses, and also because they are neighbors, family members, or related through marriage in the village. 

The members of this group work growing peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy small pieces of equipment and farming inputs, as well as to pay the labor expenses involved in hoeing their fields, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan cycle. Mama, pictured standing on the left, is a successful farmer during the rainy season in the village of Moussabougou. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farming inputs in Ségou, as well as small pieces of equipment from local blacksmiths. She also wants to pay local young people to hoe her field. She sells her produce for cash at the end of the rainy season, and uses her profits to repay her loan, as well as to have income to provide for her children and cover some of the needs of her family members.

loans.use: To buy small pieces of equipment, seeds and farming inputs, as well as to pay the labor expenses involved in hoeing her fields.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, es una persona amable, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su negocio y a su familia, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años especialmente a la siembra de güisquil, tiene mucha clientela porque su producto es fresco, de buena calidad y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus siembras logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña María está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plaga, etc. para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, a 60-year-old woman, lives in her own house with her family. She is friendly, hardworking, and very dedicated to her business and to her family.

She has worked in agriculture for many years, particularly growing chayote squash. She has many customers because her products are fresh, high-quality, and affordable.

With the money she earns from the sale of her harvest, she has been able to settle some household expenses.

María requests this loan to buy manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc. to be able to continue her business and giver her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel es originario de Estelí conocido como el diamante de las Segovia, Miguel se caracteriza por ser una persona  responsable honrada es decir de buenos principio morales, su estado civil es acompañado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Este es su segundo crédito y con el primero fue de gran importancia ya que realizo mejora en su vivienda. 

Actualmente se desempeña como fontanero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace seis años su función es brindar mantenimiento a toda la tubería potable y realizar instalación de servicio a domicilio.

solicita un crédito para gastos medicos: compra de medicamento, pago de examen y tomografía ya que sufrió un accidente laboral y le he necesario comprar medicamento y realizarse exámenes medico ya que está presentando problema en la columna vertebral.

Miguel agradece por el apoyo brindado por kiva ya que de esta manera podrá resolver el problema de salud que está presentando ya que con sus ingresos es difícil resolver por que la medicina es bastante costosa.
texts.en:
Miguel is a native of Estelí, known as "The Diamond of the Segovias". Miguel is known for being a responsible, honorable person with strong morals. He has a wife and two school-aged children. This is Miguel's second loan. With his first loan, he made major improvements on his house. 

For the last six years, Miguel has worked as a plumber for a company that offers services for aqueduct and sewage systems. He does maintenance on potable water pipes and installs home systems. Miguel is requesting a loan in order to pay some medical expenses: to buy medication, pay for a medical exam, and pay for a tomography. He needs this medical treatment because of a work accident. Now, he must buy medicine and have some exams done to assess a problem with his spine. 

Miguel is grateful for this support offered by Kiva because he is able to address his medical problem. With his earnings, it is difficult to make ends meet and cover the expensive medicine.

loans.use: to pay some medical expenses:  medication, a medical exam, and a tomography.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks, sand and cement, to build a wastewater sump.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie earns a meager income from her sari-sari store. This supports her family who are living in  Sebucao, Dumalinao, ZDS. Being a member of PMPC for 4 years, she has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP. This will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store. 

In the future, Elsie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maecel

texts.en:
Maecel earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area in Trinidad, Bohol. Maecel has been in the business for several years now. 

Maecel is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store like canned goods, candies, soda, cooking seasonings, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her store thus attracting more customers. Maecel hopes of expanding her store and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store like canned goods, candies, soda, cooking seasonings, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 58 years old and lives in Buenvista Pagadian City. She is married and has three children.

Leonida has a farm. She has been farming for five years. She has requested a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her farm.

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future she hopes to have a plantation of ampalaya.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Ednardlin

texts.en:
Ednardlin is 63 years old and lives in South Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor. He is married and has one child who is of adult-age. Ednardlin has a pension house and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional materials such as tables, chairs, beds and cabinets. Ednardlin is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ednardlin hopes to expand his business with the help of this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as tables, chairs, beds and cabinets

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy hopes to improve her living conditions and those of her one school-aged child. She is separated, but bravely supports her family through her sari-sari store business located at Labo, Ozamiz City. Daisy is seeking financial assistance from PMPC to purchase more inventory for her store. She wishes to maintain a good record of membership with the cooperative by continuously patronizing PMPC's programs and services.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 36 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married, with three school-aged children. 

Joan has a business, running a sari-sari store. She has had this business for two years. 

Joan requested a loan to purchase stock for her sari-sari store. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. 

In the future, Joan hopes to improve her living condition and to meet the family's financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is 66 years old and lives in Nonoc, Larena, Siquijor. She is married, with three children who are adult-aged.

Apolinaria has an Internet cafe and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to be used in purchasing additional computers.

Apolinaria has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, Apolinaria hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional units of computers for her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 45 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married and has two school-age and one adult–age children. Salve has a sari-sari store. She has had this business for one year.
 
Being a PMPC member for 6 years, she has maintained a member in good standing status. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.  In the future Salve hopes to improve her living conditions and sustain the financial status of their family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow and has 3 adult-aged children. The family lives in Gango, Ozamiz City where she runs her buy and sell business that earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month. She has a requested a loan buy materials to repair her house. 

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. Someday, she wants to live comfortably with her newly renovated house.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas is 24 years old and single. He runs a retail shop business in Kapsabet, and has been doing this for the last two years.

From this business, he gets a monthly income of approximately KES 28,000. He has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000, which he will use to purchase rice, sugar and cooking fat for resale. 

Dismas plans to plough back the anticipated profits into the retail shop. His dream is to expand his business to a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as rice, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has four children. She is 47 years old and resides in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Angelina sells fish while her husband does the fishing to earn a living. She's also has a piggery raising piglets for sale. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

Angelina requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and piglets to raise. Angelina joined GDMPC in 2011. 

In the future, Angelina wants to build a house and to see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 40 years old and widowed and she supports a family of five. She sells cereals and milk in a trading center 6kms from Kapsabet town served by the KADET Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last seven years; she gets an average monthly profit of Kshs 20,000.

Irine  plans to use the amount borrowed of Kshs 106,000 to purchase more cereals and milk for resale. She anticipates getting profits which she will use to expand her business as well as pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase  cereals and milk

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as committed. He has taken a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a solar panel to install in his house for lighting purposes and also charging mobile phones. He faces a challenge of high cost of fuel, hence the need for solar energy. He farms to earn an income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He hopes that in future he will have a big business for charging phones.

loans.use: buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Milalula

texts.en:
Milalula is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Milalula runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, eggs, etc..

Milalula has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Milalula would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, shampoo, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 55-year-old married woman and has four children. Two of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nilda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Nilda has been in this business for 7 years. Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra is a 41-year-old married woman.  She has has two children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pedra has a food vending business in the Philippines. Pedra requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, salt, rice, cooking oil, etc. for her business.

Pedra has been in this business for 8 years. Pedra would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, salt, rice, cooking oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. Rosario is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials to be used for her business.

Rosario has been in this business for 10 years now.

Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional metarials to be used for her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candy-making business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 35,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional ingredients for her business, like sugar and flour. She has been in this business for years now.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business, like sugar and flour.

loans.name: Sandrina

texts.en:
Sandrina is 37 years old and married with three children.

Sandrina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11000  PHP loan through NWTF to purchase  coffee, sugar, cream, noodles, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Sandrina has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years, and she earns an additional income from making handicrafts.

Sandrina aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, sugar, cream, noodles, laundry soap and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en: Rosetta lives in Logan Town. She is 32 years old, and she is married with a seven-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Rosetta did not go to school, so she decide to do business in order to make some cash to maintain her home. She has been selling cosmetics such as body spray, after-bath (body lotion), perfume, mosquito nets, etc., to improve her life. She started this business with a little money from her husband two years ago. She said that having fewer goods on her table is the only challenge she faces now. She likes her business because it is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She said, being able to paid her child school fees every semesters makes her proud of her business. Rosetta said that with the loan she is going to buy more cosmetics such as body spray, after-bath (body lotion), perfume, mosquitoes, etc., to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more by building a store, and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics such as body spray, after-bath (body lotion), perfume, mosquito nets, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married with three children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional products like sugar, rice, and other groceries to sell. 

Nilda has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Nilda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like sugar, rice, and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Please meet 28-year-old Rose from Paynesville South in Liberia. Paynesville South is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia. It is one of the areas in Montserrado County with the highest population and best standards of living. There are good roads, access to water, affordable rents and many transportation options in the area.

She is married and has two children.  Her two are ages four and seven. Only the older one is in school right now and they all are living together. She describes herself as a serious woman.

Rose owns a table business at which she has been selling fresh fish for the past three years. In her business, she faces transportation issues. The favorite part of her business is the profit she makes every time. One day, she hopes to own a house. She intends to use the loan to buy fresh fish to resell. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is a widowed woman, with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Silvina is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Silvina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Silvina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. Sarah is married and has a buy and sell feed business in the Philippines.

Sarah requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for 12 years now, and also earns additional income from selling rice.

In the future, Sarah would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 28-year-old Mamusu from Moribatown Bo. She is single with one child aged two years. She has two relatives that she take care of their school.  

Mamusu runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweets. She has been running this business for six years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Mamusu says that at present her business is doing well.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to open a savings account and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, biscuits, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Augustus T.

texts.en:
Augustus T. is 54 years old and lives in Bardnersville, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. He is married and has four children between the ages of 8 and 28; only two are presently in school and live at home. He is a high school graduate and obtained a certificate in medicine. 

Since 2006, he has been running a medicine store where he sells quinine, paracetamol, cough syrup, blood tonic, etc. He started this business with $500 USD, which he saved when he was working at a hospital as physician assistant. With this little money, he managed to establish his business and learned this ways of selling from his father. He is very happy with his business because he makes a profit and it keeps him busy. Most interestingly, he learned different kinds of local languages. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more quinine, paracetamol, cough syrup, blood tonic, etc., for his business. His plans are to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more quinine, paracetamol, cough syrup, blood tonic, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Elijah D.

texts.en: Elijah D. is running a shop which sells rice, cement, and other material in the area of Bardnersville, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. He has been running this business for the past 12 years now. He makes lots of profit and has more customers. His profits are used for rent, school fees, and to increase his saving account. Presently he faces no problem. He started this business with money given to him by his father. He has four children between 21 and 1 year old, only three of whom are in school and they all live at home. He is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, cement and other materials for his business. Elijah is 38 years old, and he is a studying at a university while running his business, he open his shop by 7am and close by 4pm since he has to attends classes three time in a week. His plan is to educate his children. He thanks the supporter for their helps.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cement and other materials for his business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 35 years old and lives in Paynesville south, which is one of the populated areas of Montserrado County. Alice is married, and has six children between 4 and 20 years old. Only three of her children are in school and live at home. 

Alice describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past 10 years, she has been running a stall where she sells soap in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers respond to it, and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. Alice walks every day to buy her goods since her shop is much closer than the local wholesale market. She is requesting a loan to purchase local soap for her business.

Alice plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase local soap for her business

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
40-year-old Papa lives in Bardnersville, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known, over-populated, and has rooms for rent that are a bit cheaper, with the option of travelling. He is married and has four children aged between 19 and 12, who live with him and attend school; his wife is a businesswoman. Papa has been running a shop for the past five years now, selling artificial hair and clothes. He started this business through his friends and learned it from them. 

Papa is asking for a loan to buy more artificial hair and clothes for his business. He enjoys how his business makes him popular. A problem that he faces is small commodities, since he has more customers. His plan is to open another branch in the nearby community. He would like to say thanks to the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more artificial hair and clothes for his business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 33 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia, which is well-known. Mohammed is unmarried and he is a high school graduate. He has two children who stay at home, and the oldest one is in school.

For the past nine years Mohammed has been selling engine repair parts, generator parts, car parts, and motorcycle parts in the community. He makes a lot of profit since he is the only one who is involved in this business, and he sells qualities product in his community. One of the problems he is facing is that he has less income. Mohammed is requesting a loan to purchase more generator parts, vehicle parts, and motorbike parts for his business. He plans to build a house for his children in years to come and educate them. He would like to appreciate all the lenders of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more generator parts, vehicle parts, and motorbike parts for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coconut leaves and thread for preparing roofing materials to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 52-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 7 years and 13 years. Two of her children are attending school. She started business because she needs to create a permanent source of income to support the home.  

Kadiatu runs a retail business; she sells floor mats, sets of pans,  and plates. She has been running this business since 2002. She works at the business seven to twelve hours per day.  Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is that transporting her goods from the city to her business place is very difficult.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase items including floor mats, sets of pans and plates for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build a permanent business location. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase  items like floor mats, sets of pans and plates for resale

loans.name: Sabatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Sabatu from Kandeh town. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 5 and 11 years.  Her children are attending school. 

Sabatu runs a palm oil business; she sells palm oil, nut oil and beans.  She has been running this business for 6 years. She works at the business throughout the week. Sabatu says that her business is doing well.

Sabatu has requested a loan in order to purchase food items including gallons of palm oil and gari (cassava flakes). The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her family's standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she hopes to export her goods. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items including gallons of palm oil and gari

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent lives in Mombasa Kenya. She is 35 years old, married and has a ten-year-old child. She sells second hand clothes at the local market and she has been in this business for more than six years. This business is the sole income earner for her and she has to make it succeed. 

She found out about  Milango through a friend at a time when she wanted funding for the business. She joined and she is now seeking a loan to buy ten extra bales of second hand clothes to resell. The challenge in the business is unstable prices and inflation. 

The extra income that she earns will help her pay school fees for her child. Their living standards will also to improve as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy ten extra bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 59-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a happy family because her husband and son earn sufficient income to meet daily household expenses. Her son has been running a mobile repairing shop since 2004 in a nearby town. He is very professional and experienced in his work; most of the clients become his close friends and like to have their mobiles repaired by him. Her husband is very hardworking and honest. He demands very low service charges for his services; that is why people like to have their mobiles repaired by him. Due to his honesty and low rates he has created a good reputation and goodwill in his community. 

His shop is situated in a populated area. A few days ago someone stole some electronic parts from his shop; now he is unable to repair mobile phones. He does not have much savings to buy these electronic parts again. 

Mumtaz requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy electronic parts to carry on his business. She hopes that through this loan more customers will be attracted toward his shop, which will lead to an increase in income and savings. She praises the lenders and is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electronic parts for a mobile repairing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike for his business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is requesting a $600 USD to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, salt, soap, eggs, noodles, and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels  comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Elvira independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, soap, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has requested a $600 USD loan to improve her business.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She is married and she is 30 years old.  With the loan she will buy some additional supplies such as soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer) noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, sugar, and a refrigerator to keep the drinks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Veronica  independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, and cigarettes

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon es un joven de 27 años que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Está dedicado a la caficultura desde pequeño y es parte del grupo de productores afiliados a la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) que está dentro del proceso de certificación Comercio Justo. Además de café, él cultiva banano, frijoles y maíz para autoconsumo y una pequeña parte para la venta local. Ha tenido 4 créditos de PAC los cuales ha cancelado en tiempo y forma y han sido para el mantenimiento de su finca. En el último ciclo, el rendimiento de café por manzana en su finca fue de 30 quintales pergamino. Para este ciclo está solicitando un préstamo para garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su cafetal, con lo cual espera mejorar la producción en cantidad y calidad y obtener mayores ingresos. Su meta es seguir invirtiendo en la productividad de su finca para darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marlon is a young man who is 27 years of age. He lives with his wife and two children in a community in northern Nicaragua. Marlon has been growing coffee from a young age and is part of a group of producers affiliated with the Association for People in Community Action (PAC). This group is also in the process of becoming certified Fair Trade growers. In addition to coffee, Marlon grows bananas, beans, and corn for personal consumption and a small portion of those crops is sold to a local store. He has received four loans from PAC that were repaid on time and according to terms. Having this money has helped to maintain his farm. In this past crop cycle, the yield per 1.74 acres of his farm was 30 quintals of coffee beans in parchment (1 quintal = 46 kg).

For this crop cycle, Marlon is requesting a loan that will secure the maintenance of his coffee farm. He hopes to improve production, in terms of both quantity and quality, so that he can generate better income. His goal is to continue investing in the productivity of his farm so that his children can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 28 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a construction worker for more than five years, earning approximately $10 daily. Due to the difficulty with transportation, Ny is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. 

This purchase will enable her to get to work faster and save some money on transportation expenses to help support her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of raising pigs to generate more income to financially support the family and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Proun

texts.en:
Proun is 57 years old. She is widowed and resides with her son in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for more than five years, earning approximately $8 daily. Her son is employed as Credit officer in a microfinance institution. He earns about $11 daily. 

To expand her store’s space, Proun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timber and zinc sheets to build the grocery store. This money will help her obtain a bigger space for storage. In the future, she would like to add more stock to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc sheets to build the grocery store

loans.name: Estela Alexander

texts.es: Estela de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación desde hace 12  años, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su  hogar. Estela solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Estela is 37 years old and lives with her family in their own home. She has been selling tortillas from her home for 12 years. Estela works Monday through Sunday and has many customers since she is a hardworking and friendly individual. With the profits she earns, she is able to cover her household expenses.

Estela is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn by the quintal (1 quintal = 46 kg) and lime powder so that she can continue making tortillas. As a result, she will generate better earnings and provide better financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Mauricio Ernesto

texts.es: Mauricio de 36 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren  por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; él necesita invertir en sus siembras por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida,  abonos, fertilizantes, etc. Mauricio tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 36, lives with his wife and his two children in his own house.  He makes a living growing corn and beans.  He has worked in agriculture for several years, which has given him a lot of experience that allows him to get the best harvests.  He sells his harvests on the outskirts of his community.  He has a lot of customers who prefer him because of the quality of his product, his good prices, and above all his good service.

He needs to invest in his fields, so he's requesting a loan to buy seed, insecticide, herbicide, soil amendments, fertilizer, etc.

Mauricio has a good payment record among his acquaintances and he's very responsible.  He's certain he'll be able to repay the debt by the deadline.  He also trusts he'll bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seed, insecticide, herbicide, soil amendments, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Gulnisa

texts.ru: Гулнисе 56 лет, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Гулниса имеет высшее образование и на сегодняшний день работает в местной школе преподавателем. Гулниса известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. Большой опыт и преданность своему делу позволили Гулнисе получить очень много почетных грамот и наград таких как -заслуженный деятель образования. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2004 году Гулниса начала свой бизнес в откорме скота. Стартовав с 30,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Гулнисы имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, и овцы. Также имеет земельный надел размером 2, 15 ГА, где в основном выращивают фасоль. На арендованном земельном наделе, размером 5 ГА выращивает клевер. Доходы от бизнеса Гулниса вложила в оплату за образование своих детей. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулниса обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на закупку скота. Доходы от кредита Гулниса планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и хочет построить дополнительный сарай для содержания скота.
texts.en: Gulnisa is 56 years old, married and has four children.  Gulnisa has a higher education and currently works as a teacher at a local school.  She is known as a person with principles, honest and kind.  Extensive experience and devotion to her business allowed Gulnisa to receive many recognitions and awards, such as the distinguished educator.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Gulnisa started her own business of fattening up livestock in 2004.  Started with 30,000 som (KGS), today her business yields a monthly profit in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS).  Gulnisa's business contains one dairy cow, one calf and sheep.  She also has a land plot f 2.15 hectares, where she primarily grows beans.  She also grows clover on 5 hectares of leased land.  Gulnisa invested the earnings from the business in paying for her children's education.  In order to further develop her business, Gulnisa requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase livestock headcount and wants to build an additional barn for keeping livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбаре 50 лет, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Супруг помогает ей по хозяйству. В поисках  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1983 году Гулбара начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 1,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленка, 4 лошади. Также занимается выращиванием овощей таких как: фасоль, перец, картошку для продажи, имеет земельный надел размером 2,15 ГА. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулбара планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также в будущем хочет построить дом.
texts.en: Gulbara is 50 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband helps her with the business.  In search of a source of income for her family, Gulbara started her own farming and animal husbandry business in 1983.  Started with 1,000 som (KGS), today her business yields a monthly profit in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS).  The business contains two dairy cows, one calf and four horses.  She is also involved in growing vegetables, such as beans, peppers and potatoes, for sale and has a land plot of 2.15 hectares.  In order to further develop her business, Gulbara requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy livestock to increase livestock headcount.  She plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase livestock headcount and also wants to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now the vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shahnaz has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do some engine maintenance needed for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. 

Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Shahnaz is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance and renovation of their rickshaw.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school, Joyce works very hard to provide for them.

Joyce runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Joyce would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alina

texts.ru: Алина, 24 года, не замужем. В 2012 году открыла танцевальную студию, в студию танцев ходят обучаться более 50 девочек, за определенную плату. Начала этот бизнес с 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее неустанному труду и выдержке на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 20,000 сом KGS. Алина обучает девочек танцам. Ее танцевальная группа принимает участие во всеразличных конкурсах и мероприятиях. Алина обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 30,000 сом(KGS)  для пошива костюмов для танцевальной группы. На доходы от кредита Алина планирует развить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Alina is 24 years old and single.  She opened a dance studio, currently attended by over 50 girls at a set price, in 2012.  She started this business with 30,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her tiredless work and stamina, today she earns a monthly profit in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS).  Alina teaches dance to girls.  Her dance group takes part in various competitions and events.  Alina requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to sew costumes for the dance group.  Alina plans to use the earnings from the loan to develop her business.

loans.use: to sew dance costumes

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, 45, is an experienced farmer and mother of nine children from the farming area of Chibombo District, Zambia. Martha has been producing butternut squash, cucumbers, and tomatoes for local markets for more than 10 years. She is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand her farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Martha, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive, even for successful and experienced farmers like Martha. Once she secures a loan, Martha will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Martha will be able to irrigate her crops in less time while also expanding her farm to include onion and green bean crops. She hopes to use the profits from her expanded farm to continue to support her children in school and to pay for future farming input needs.
 
It is for this reason Martha is asking Kiva lenders to help her with the loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon, 58, is an experienced farmer with six children from Kabwe District, Zambia. Solomon has been producing vegetables for local markets for more than 20 years. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Solomon, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive, even for successful and experienced farmers like Solomon. Once he secures a loan, Solomon will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Solomon will be able to irrigate his crops in less time while also expanding his farm and reaching new markets. He hopes to use some of the profits from his expanded farm to purchase cattle for his dairy business.
 
It is for this reason Solomon is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha, 56, has six children and is a farmer from Petauke District, Zambia. He has been producing tomatoes, cabbage, and various greens from a small field to sell at a local market. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to be used to irrigate and expand his farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Elisha, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Elisha will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Elisha will be able to irrigate his crops in less time while also expanding his farm. Elisha hopes to increase his income through supplying a larger quantity of vegetables to local marketers, and even begin to produce different types of crops. With extra income he plans on supporting his children in school and improve his farm by setting up a wire fence to keep animals from damaging his crops. 

It is for this reason Elisha is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Office

texts.en:
Office, 24, is a young, determined farmer from the farming region of Chibombo District. Currently he grows tomatoes and watermelons to sell at the road-side markets so that he can support seven family members. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Office, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Office will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Office will no longer have to carry water buckets to his farm from the well that he dug by hand. He will be able to irrigate his crops in less time while also expanding his farm. He hopes to grow his farm so that he can continue to support his children in school, and eventually he would like to buy his own animals. It is for this reason Office is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, 51, has seven children and is an experienced farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia. He has been producing fresh maize, watermelons, onions, and butternut squash for the past 10 years. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to be used to irrigate and expand his farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Vincent, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Vincent will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Vincent will be able to irrigate his crops in less time while also expanding his farm. He hopes to be able to produce enough to hire a vehicle to transport his crops to sell at a major market in Lusaka, the capital city. Vincent plans to invest the new profits in animals, which can also help him to plough his fields in future years.

It is for this reason Vincent is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 45, has six children and is a farmer from Petauke District, where he grows fresh maize, tomatoes, and onions. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as George, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, George will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, George will no longer have to carry water buckets to his farm from the nearby river. He will be able to irrigate his crops in less time while also expanding his farm. He hopes to grow his farm so that he can continue to support his children in school. It is for this reason George is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson, 58, is an experienced farmer from Kabwe District, Zambia. He has been producing vegetables for local markets for more than 10 years, and more recently has been selling his produce to a local trades college. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Anderson, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive, even for successful and experienced farmers like Anderson. Once he secures a loan, Anderson will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Anderson will be able to irrigate his crops in less time while also expanding his farm to include tomatoes, cabbage, and even watermelon. He hopes to also be able to hire part-time workers to help him with his expanded fields. It is for this reason Anderson is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Evah

texts.en:
Evah, 44, is an experienced farmer and mother of three children from Kabwe District, Zambia. Evah has been producing fresh maize, cabbage, and tomatoes for local markets in Kabwe for more than 10 years. She is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand her farm.

Equipment such as a water pump can be a major boost for many vegetable farmers such as Evah, as it allows for increased production and more predictable yields due to irrigation. Unfortunately, the upfront cost of such a water pump can be very prohibitive, even for successful and experienced farmers like Evah. Once she secures a loan, Evah will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a pump, Evah plans to put to use some of the new farming techniques she has learned at recent training workshops and expand her production. She hopes to use the profits from her expanded farm to continue to support her children in school and to pay for future farming input needs.
 
It is for this reason Evah is asking Kiva lenders to help her with the loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Roon

texts.en: Roon is 49 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making flute cases which are made of palm leaves to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a carpenter who makes an income of $5 per day. In addition, they are rice farmer. Therefore, she would like to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help reduce her farming expenses. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate more income to stabilize her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 39 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening pigs for more than $6 daily. Her husband runs the business of buying cattle to resell for a profitable price. He makes an income of $10 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phalla is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase piglets to raise and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would make more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor's degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 3 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Moussabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Mariatou (2ème   femme assise à gauche  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Moussabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of Benkadi 3 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 37 and on average two children. They all live in the village of  Moussabougou, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through their rainy season agricultural activities, through bonds of neighborhood, marriage and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet and rice. 

Wishing to buy tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to pay day laborers to weed the fields, the group members turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second seasonal loan. 

 Madame Mariatou (the second woman seated, from left to right in the photo) is greatly involved in rainy season agricultural activities in the village of     Moussabougou. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds, to purchase agricultural inputs in Ségou and tools from the local blacksmiths, and pay young men to weed her field. The sale of her produce is made for cash at the end of the rainy season, in order to repay her loan and have cash on hand to cover expenses for the children,  and some of those for the family.

loans.use: to buy tools, seeds and agricultural inputs, and to pay day laborers to weed her field.

loans.name: Monica Antonieta

texts.es: Mónica vive en casa propia con su familia,  ella se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras papas, güisquiles, repollos, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Mónica es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar verduras por mayor. Mónica tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mónica lives in her own house with her family.  She makes a living buying and selling potatoes, chayote, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, chili pepper, and other vegetables.  She has been in the business for several years, which gives her a lot of experience in sales and allows her to get the best profits.  She sells in a strategic location that's very busy.  She has a lot of customers who prefer her because her product is fresh, affordable, and high quality, and her service is excellent.

Mónica's an enterprising woman who's dedicated to her job and very much wants to get ahead.  She's always looking for alternatives that will allow her to be successful.

Demand has increased in the past few weeks and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment.  She doesn't have sufficient capital, however, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy vegetables wholesale.

Mónica has a good payment record.  She's grateful for the support and certain she'll be able to repay the debt.  She also trusts she'll give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, chayote, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and chili peppers wholesale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 21 años es un hombre responsable y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su abuela y tía en la casa que heredaron hace 10 años. Luis se dedica a la ganadería, todas las mañanas cuida de los animales que pronto venderá en la feria ganadera que se realiza todos los fines de semana. Tiene muchos años de experiencia, pues según comenta desde niño su padre le enseño el negocio, ahora lo realiza de manera independiente, es decir su trabajo consiste en la compra de animales como vacas, ovejas, cuyes y gallos, los cuales cuida durante la semana para vender los días domingos en la feria. Gusta mucho del negocio, pues le permite perfeccionarse en la crianza de animales. Ahora desea seguir en este trabajo perfeccionar su habilidad y ser uno de los mejores. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Luis, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Luis, 21 years old, is a responsible and hard-working man. He lives in the company of his grandmother and aunt in the home that they inherited 10 years ago. Luis makes a living in stockbreeding. Every morning he takes care of the animals that he will soon sell in the livestock market that occurs every weekend.
