He has many years of experience. He mentions that as a child, his father taught him the business. Now, he works independently, that is, his work consists of the purchase of animals such as cows, sheep, guinea pigs, and roosters, which he takes care of during the week to sell on Sundays at the market. He likes the business a lot since it allows him to perfect animal breeding. Now, he wishes to continue in this work to perfect his ability and be one of the best. 

This is his second loan from Kiva, and he feels thankful for the financial support that he is receiving to continue ahead. Furthermore, he promises to make his payments punctually. Luis will invest the 1500 Nuevos Soles in the purchase of a milk cow to increase his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Polleritas Multicolor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POLLERITAS MULTICOLOR”  iniciará el quinto primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marisol es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de polleras, taller de serigrafía, costura de deportivos, costura de poleras, servicio de taxi.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marisol es integrante, ella indica que hace es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de polleras; este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus tías y primas, posteriormente decide instalar su propio taller empezando con pocos ahorros y posteriormente instalo más equipos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Polleritas Multicolor” will begin the fifth first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Villa Adela. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a governing board of which Marisol is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied.  Among them are: sewing, a silk-screening workshop, sewing sports clothing, sewing t-shirts, and a taxi service. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-companies such as Marisol’s. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, becoming a member through an invitation from her sister, who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business sewing and selling t-shirts. She learned this business many years ago from her aunts and cousins. Later, she decided to establish her own workshop, beginning with little savings and later installing more equipment.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of resources (the purchase of cloth) that she will acquire in the wholesale stores of the city of El Alto. Later, she will commercialize production in her sale space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible. She lives in an open relationship, and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Reyes Isabel

texts.es: Reyes vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz, frijol y arroz comercializa sus productos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, reyes esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semilla, herbicidas, controles de plaga, fertilizantes, etc. para poder seguir con sus siembras y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reyes lives in his own house with his wife. He makes a living in agriculture, mainly by planting corn, beans, and rice. He sells his products to agencies which purchase and sell basic grains. With his earnings, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. 

Reyes is applying for a loan to buy manure, seeds, herbicides, insecticides, fertilizer, etc. so that he can continue planting his crops and earn a better income to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, herbicides, insecticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene 29 años, el se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Jose va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes por mayor,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería,  El Sr. Jose enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su puesto y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jose, 29, sells staple consumer goods from his stall in the area of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. This is his second loan with the institution. Jose will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock his business, such as wholesale groceries. His reason for applying for this loan is the great demand he is experiencing. His sales are rising and he needs to stock up on merchandise. 

Jose faces some challenges in his businesses, such as competition from various other stores in the area. He will use this loan to buy more merchandise to stock his business and continue growing more and more every day. 

His wish for his business is to continue selling products and to have a well-stocked store. He will then be able to grow his business, increase his earnings, and finally improve his quality of life and that of his family. He feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as wholesale groceries.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Rogelio de 62 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 20 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; Rogelio está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida,  fertilizantes, abonos, etc. Rogelio tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 62, lives with his life partner and their two children in his own house. He makes a living growing corn and beans. He has been working in agriculture for 20 years, which has given him plenty of experience to help him obtain the best harvests. He sells his harvested crops around his community. He has a large clientele who prefer his products for their quality, for the good prices he offers, and above all for his good service.

Rogelio is applying for a loan to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, etc. Rogelio has good credit references from his acquaintances. He is very responsible and he is sure that he will be able to pay off this debt within the established time frame. At the same time, he trusts that he will be able to bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina nació en la ciudad de Acomayo pero vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión de libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, fierros, ladrillos,  arena, yeso, piedra chancada y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena y cemento, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Segundina, 29, was born in the city of Acomayo, but she lives in the city of Paucartambo. She is in a common-law marriage, from which she has two children. She is a hardworking, enterprising person who provides for her family with the effort she puts into her work. Her main business activity is selling construction materials, such as cement, iron, bricks, sand, plaster, and crushed stone, among others. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the "Señor de Coyllority" communal bank. 

She needs this loan to buy construction materials, such as sand and cement. She appreciates and values this loan, and she is committed to paying her monthly installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as sand and cement.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 55-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children, from Bien Unido, Bohol. Marissa runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Marissa is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, toiletries, cooking ingredients, and seasonings. With this loan, she will be able to expand the diversity of items at her store. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save money for the expansion of her business and to repay her loan on-time.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, toiletries, cooking ingredients, and seasonings.

loans.name: Norly

texts.en: Norly is a merchant from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in clothing sales for more than two years. This is the source of her income. Norly is applying for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as slippers, shirts, pants, underwear and other clothing. With this loan, she will be able to add to her stock and sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as slippers, shirts, pants, underwear and other clothing.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 60 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. She is married and has four children. To earn a living, Evangeline has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. Evangeline has applied for a loan to buy additional ingredients, including flour, sugar, oil and butter. Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to improve and expand her business at this site.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and butter, to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is married and has four children. Annie is 28 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines. Annie sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent and soap. Annie has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Annie hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, including canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent and soap.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina  is a farmer and grows  coconuts to earn a living. She is widowed with four children and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. She has requested financial help from PMPC to purchase additional farming equipment.  Celestina has kept her membership for eight years as a member in good standing. In the future, Celestina hopes to improve and expand her coconut production.

loans.use: to purchase additional farming equipment

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 62 years old. Teresita is married with four children. 

To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been in her business for two years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase eggs and canned and bottled products.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and canned and bottled products

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Guia

texts.en:
Guia is 69 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Guia has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 1900 each month doing this type of work. Guia has requested a loan  to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, etc.

Guia has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Guia would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza, 55, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a vendor and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Esperanza operates a market stall. She sells fruit and vegetable products in the community market. She buys a quantity of fruits and vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. 

Esperanza dreams of a business expansion and hopes to help her family in financial terms. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sulpicia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Sulpicia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Sulpicia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build up her rice retailing business.

Sulpicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a 'buy and sell' rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Gloria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice for her business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a computer shop business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers. She has been in this business for three years now.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computers

loans.name: Hedeliza

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Hedeliza works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from growing vegetables and selling them. Hedeliza is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy stock to sell in her store, including soap, milk, shampoo, spices and cooking oil. Hedeliza has been sustaining her business activities with her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her store, including soap, milk, shampoo, spices and cooking oil.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 59 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business, including shells and nylon thread. Teresita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business, including shells and nylon thread.

loans.name: Adela Sofia

texts.es: Adela es una joven entusiasta de 28 años de edad, es graduada de bachiller Técnico en Computación.  Vive con madre la Sra. Sofia y su hermano Olman.  Recientemente han sufrido la perdida de su padre siendo ellos mismos los llamados a salir adelante para poder obtener un mejor futuro.  Adela actualmente esta esforzándose por cursar sus últimas 3 clases de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas en la Universidad Técnica de Honduras.  Tiene claro sus objetivos de profesionalizarse lo antes posible para contribuir a mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, por lo que paralelamente esta realizando su práctica profesional en un empresa hondureña que le ha abierto las puertas, Adela espera graduarse en el mes marzo del 2014 y espera poder contribuir al desarrollo de grandes proyectos en el área de comunicaciones y ser un agente de cambio en Honduras.
texts.en:
Adela is an enthusiastic 28-year-old young woman. She has completed a technical degree in Computer Technology. She lives with her mother, Sofia, and her brother, Olman. They recently suffered the loss of her father leaving them to get ahead in order to secure a better future.

Currently, Adela is pushing forward in completing her last three classes for a degree in Systems Engineering at the Universidad Técnica de Honduras [Technical University of Honduras]. She has very clear goals of getting professional experience as soon as possible so that she can contribute to improving her family's quality of life. This is why she has an internship at a Honduran company which is opening doors for her. 

Adela hopes to graduate in March of 2014. She also hopes to be able to contribute to the development of major communications projects and to be an agent for change in Honduras.

loans.use: to finance her last three university classes.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 65 years old, married and has six children. 

Bebiana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bebiana has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Bebiana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Susana is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susana has been pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as laundry soap, noodles, milk, coffee, snack foods, soft drinks, sugar, etc. 

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shavraly

texts.ru: Шавралы 65 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Супруга домохозяйка помогает ему по хозяйству. Они оба на пенсии, но не сидят сложав руки.  В поисках  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1993 году Шавралы начал заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 30,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 9,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 3 лошади, 4 дойные коровы с телятами, 60 овец. Также имеет земельный надел размером 2,40 ГА, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и многолетние травы. Дополнительно материальная помощь высылается старшим сыном, который находится на заработках в России. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шавралы обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на закупку овец. Доходы от кредита Шавралы планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Shavraly is 65 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife and she helps him with his business. They are both on a pension, but they do not sit idly by. In search of a source of income for his family, Shavraly started working with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding in 1993. Having started with a sum of 30,000 som (KGS), his business currently brings in a monthly profit of around 9,000 som (KGS). His business includes three horses, four dairy cows with offspring and 60 sheep. 

Shavraly also has a plot of land of the size of 2.40 hectares, where he mainly grows beans and perennial grasses. The eldest son, who is a migrant worker in Russia, also sends additional financial aid. 

To further develop his business, Shavraly turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tuhsum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. Shavraly plans to spend the income from the loan on increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
A $1,200 loan is offered to Anastasia to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like trousers, shorts, and long sleeve and short sleeve shirts. Anastasia is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Anastasia is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, and long sleeve and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta, who is married, works hard to support her family by buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. In business for 40 years now, she has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

In the future, Henrietta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tes hijos de 17, 14 y 3 años de edad, la clienta es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia, 35, lives in her own house with her husband and her three children, ages 17, 14, and 3.  She's very well known in the area where she lives because of her modesty and her devotion to her job.  She has never given up and always has made progress with her problems.

With effort and dedication she has a store where she sells staples: basic grains, milk, eggs, rice, and other products.  She's very dedicated to her job and very obliging when it comes time to sell.  This is why she has customers who seek her out and prefer her.

She has seen the need to stock her store a little more because demand has increased.  She doesn't have the capital to do this, so she's requesting a loan to buy more products such as basic grains, instant food, sweets, beverages, etc.

She trusts in God that soon the help she has requested will be granted and her only worry will be the daily support of her household.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Srey Ny

texts.en:
Srey Ny is 37 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running grocery store for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 each day. 

With the loan of $500, Srey Ny will be able to add more groceries to her stock. By doing so, she will generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family.

loans.use: to add more groceries to her stock.

loans.name: Heam

texts.en: Heam is 59 years old. She is married and resides with a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her child is employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 daily. With the loan of $1200, Heam is able to purchase a water pump and fertilizer to use for rice cultivation. This purchase will help her provide a high yield of crops. In the future, she would like to expand her farmland and build a bigger house.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and fertilizer to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en: Phanna is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. In order to improve her business, Phanna is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase weaving materials to use in her business. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials to use in her business

loans.name: Heanh

texts.en: Heanh is 62 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Heanh is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase cows to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she would be able to earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it bigger to provide enough space for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and produce calves to sell

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan is 50 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

For more than two years, she has been growing vegetables to sell, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, helps her run the business. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They make an income of $15 per day. 

With the loan of $700 from KREDIT, Sokhan will purchase a water pump to use for her farming. In addition, a part of this money will be used to buy vegetable seeds for cultivation. This purchase will help her provide a high yield and earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her farmland and rebuild her house to make it bigger and more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to use for her farming.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married, 36 year-old mother of three in Thika. Ann has been running a grocery shop for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 14,000 which she uses to support her family. Ann is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing KADET client.  She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk for her grocery store. She will plow back the proceeds into the business. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk

loans.name: Naarkul

texts.ru: Нааркул, 59 лет, замужем, имеет двух взрослых сыновей. Образование-средне-специальное. С 1982 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 9,000 сом KGS. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. Благодаря упорному труду Нааркул, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок и 5 овец. Также в наличии имеет 3,15 ГА поливной земли на которой ежегодно сажает пшеницу и ячмень. Прибыль позволила Нааркул размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нааркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Нааркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Naarkul is 59 years old, married, and has two adult children. She has specialized secondary education. Since 1982 she has worked with farming - livestock breeding and field crop cultivation - after having started this business with a sum of 9,000 som (KGS). Her husband and children help her with the business. 

Thanks to Naarkul's persistent work, she currently has a good farm: One dairy cow, one steer and five sheep. She also has 3.15 hectares of irrigated land available, on which she plants wheat and barley every year. The income allowed Naarkul to multiply the number of livestock at the far, and thereby improve the family's well-being. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Naarkul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of steers. Naarkul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and in the future she also plans to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase steers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a young man who is passionate about fish and aquariums. He identified his passion early and decided to pursue it. Peter built and sold his first aquarium in 2009, and he has not looked back since. He has successfully sold aquariums to family, friends, and others. Based on his dedication and enthusiasm, today he has more than 15 aquariums that he also services. 

Peter is the first born in a family of three children and was inspired to venture into entrepreneurship by his grandfather who is a successful entrepreneur. He served as the deputy CEO of his enterprise in high school, where he sharpened his leadership and entrepreneurship skills through the Junior Achievement program. His intention is to grow his business by constructing more aquariums and a fish breeding unit so that he can eventually have his unique breed of fish that he will sell to customers.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for aquariums and a fish breeding unit for his aquarium business

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega is 49 years old and single. Diega works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like coffee, seasonings, milk, snack foods, etc. in her general store.  Diega has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Diega aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell like coffee, seasonings, milk, snack foods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es: Juan, a sus 23 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 1 año y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Su vida productiva la ha dedicado a laborar como empleado en una barbería de un amigo, donde obtuvo conocimientos y experiencia es esta labor. Hace 3 años decidió independizarse y montó su propia barbería en el barrio donde reside, aprovechando que no tiene competencia en el sector, por lo que hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien. Juan es un joven enérgico, activo, responsable y con espíritu emprendedor, siempre va buscando opciones que le permitan mejorar su nivel de vida, por esta razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido e insumos de trabajo (gel para el cabello, lacas, tinturas, shampoo, gorras, entre otros) con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio y ofrecer productos de buena calidad a sus clientes, lo cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y a tener más ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Juan sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y adecuar el local para poner una sala de video juegos, alternando las dos actividades, esto le permitirá generar empleo para otras personas y mejorará sus ingresos para brindarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: At 23 years old, Juan is the father of a 1-year-old son and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. He dedicated his productive life to working as an employee in a friend's barber shop, where he obtained knowledge and experience in this line of work. Three years ago he decided to become independent and opened his own barber shop in the neighborhood where he lives. He took advantage of the fact that he has no competition in the area, so up to now it has gone very well for him. Juan is an energetic, active, responsible young man with an entrepreneurial spirit. He is always looking for options that will allow him to improve his standard of living. This is why he is asking for the loan to buy stock items and work supplies (hair gel, spray, dye, shampoo, and gloves, among others) with the goal of providing better service and offering quality products to his customers, which will help him to improve his sales and have more income to provide daily sustenance to his household. Juan dreams of making his business grow and outfitting the shop to put in a video game room, alternating between the two activities. This would allow him to create employment for other people, and it would improve his income to provide his family with economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items and work supplies (hair gel, spray, dye, shampoo, and gloves, among others)

loans.name: Alix Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia, a sus 31 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 7 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Durante su vida productiva laboró en empresas y casas como empleada de oficios varios con lo cual obtenía ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Hace 3 años se le presentó la oportunidad de independizarse y con unos ahorros que tenía compró una tienda de abarrotes y víveres en general, ya que la antigua dueña se iba a vivir a otro país. Desde entonces ha luchado incansablemente para sostener su negocio y poder generar ingresos para seguir aportando al sostenimiento de su hogar. Eugenia es una mujer pujante, trabajadora y dedicada a  su familia, que son su principal motivación para  seguir avanzando en busca de mejores oportunidades. Solicita un tercer ciclo de crédito como apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (mecato, huevos, gaseosas, galletería, productos lácteos) y realizar unas mejoras en el local (arreglar una humedad en la pared), con esto podrá darle continuidad a su negocio, tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar una mejor percepción de la imagen locativa, esto le ayudará a aumentar sus ventas y obtener más recursos,  con lo cual podrá hacer crecer su tienda, para que sea estable, reconocida en el sector y perdurable en el tiempo. Es así como podrá lograr darle una mejor educación y bienestar a su hijo y tener una estabilidad económica para tener un futuro próspero en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 31 years old, has a 7-year-old son and lives with her boyfriend. During her working life she has worked in companies and houses doing various functions, which allowed her to make income to support the household. Three years ago she had the opportunity to work on her own, and with some savings that she had, she bought a grocery and home goods store, as the previous owner was going to live in another country. Since then she she has strived tirelessly to keep her business going and generate income to continue helping  to support her household. 
Eugenia is a strong and hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family, which is her main motivation to continue seeking better opportunities. She is requesting a third loan to help her buy merchandise (pastries, eggs, soda, cookies, dairy products) and make some improvements to the premises (fix a wet spot on the wall). 
With this, she will be able to continue with her business, have a larger variety of products to offer her customers, and make more income, with which she will be able to grow her store and make it stable, well known in the area, and long lasting. This way she will be able to give her son a better education and well-being, and have economic stability in order to have a prosperous future with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (pastries, eggs, soda, cookies, dairy products) and make some improvements to the premises (fix a wet spot on the wall).

loans.name: Iwo Jima

texts.en:
Iwo Jima is 48 years old.  She is married and has one child.  Iwo Jima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and other groceries in her general store.  Iwo Jima has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling herbal medicines.

Iwo Jima aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.ru: Тинатин 59 лет, замужем, многодетная мать имеет 6 детей (4 сына и 2 дочери). Образование-средне-специальное. На протяжении долгих лет работала в торговой сфере. После распада Союза, и потеряв работу с 1994 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 500 сом (KGS). Супруг и дети активно помогают по бизнесу. Благодаря упорному труду Тинатин, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 1 жеребенок, 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 10 ягнят. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел, на которой выращивает: картошку, клевер и кукурузу. Прибыль позволила Тинатин размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тинатин обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с приплодом. Доходы от кредита Тинатин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также улучшить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en:
Tinatin is 59 years old, married, and is the mother of as many as six children (four sons and two daughters). She has specialized secondary education. For many years, she worked in sales. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, and after having lost her job, she has since 1994 worked with farming - livestock breeding and field crop cultivation - after having started this business with a sum of 500 som (KGS). Her husband and children actively help her with the business.

Thanks to Tinatin's persistent work, she currently has a good farm: One foal, two dairy cows, 20 sheep and 10 lambs. She also has a plot of land available, on which she grows potatoes, bread and corn. The income allowed Tinatin to multiply the number of livestock in her family and at the same time increase the family's well-being. 

With an aim to further develop her business Tinatin turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow with offspring. Tinatin plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number livestock, and also to improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en la casa de sus padres.
Se caracteriza por tener un semblante fuerte, ello lo demuestra en su trabajo, pues como buena mujer dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura. Oficio que aprendió desde muy pequeña, y que en la actualidad aprovecha para poder generar ingresos para su familia. Todavía no tiene una pareja ni hijos, “estar al lado de mis hermanos y padres me hace sentir feliz”, comenta. Sus principales sembríos constan de maíz y papa. Lo que comercializa a otras ciudades del país. Como toda mujer entusiasta, ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias y además está ahorrando dinero para poder comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ya que no cuenta con unos propios. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Nélida, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Nélida, 34, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her parents and her siblings in her parents' house. She is characterized as having a strong persona, which she demonstrates through her work. Like a good woman, she dedicates her time and efforts to agriculture, which she learned about from a very young age. She now takes advantage of this knowledge to earn an income for her family. She still does not have a partner or children. "Being around my siblings and parents makes me happy," she says. Her main crops are corn and potatoes, which she sells in other cities in the country. 

As an enthusiastic woman, she now wishes to increase her earnings. She is also saving up to buy her own farmland, because she does not have her own. This is her second Kiva loan. She feels that she has developed and she is happy with Kiva. She would like to have this loan to continue with her goals. Nélida will invest these 500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mazingira-1A Group

texts.en:
Kisra, who is in her early 40s, is married and has two sons who are in college. For four years now, Kisra has been managing her life by running a clothes shop. She is doing great in her enterprise. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good profit every month. This is her 11th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to stock more clothes to resell. With Kisra's previous loans, all of which repaid successfully, she managed to buy more stock, which sold out. With the profit received from her business, she managed to cover her boys' tuition fees, pay her home expenses and start building a family house. Kisra dreams that one day will be able to own a big clothing shop. 

Kisra will share this loan with her loan group Mazingira-1a, which totals 8 clients. The clients of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub, a father of two from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He also runs a motorcycle transport business as his secondary business. He is married to Jane, who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of KES 11,000, which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his first loan term with KADET. With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase poultry feed and purchase one-day-old chicks for rearing. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. 

In the future, Ayub would like to build a permanent store to keep his cereals and other grains and also buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and one-day-old chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a married mother of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. This marks her third loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

With the loan she has applied for from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feed, animal feed, seedlings and fertilizers. The additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and to reinvest the remaining amount in her business. 

In the future, Mary would like to expand her farming land. She hopes to save money to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed, animal feed, seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 38 years old and married with one child. He runs an electronics shop in Kangundo town, where he sells electronics and also does electronics repair. He also sells phones and phone accessories. He has been in this business for 13 years, and it has been profitable.

This being his first loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy phone spare parts and phone accessories for selling. These include screen-savers, phone covers, batteries and chargers. He hopes to generate more income, which he will use to add more stock of electronics.

Clement hopes to grow his business and open more phone accessories shops.

loans.use: to buy phone spare parts, phone accessories, and electronics.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 55 years old, married, and mother of one daughter. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her family. For the past 10 years, she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Fatma’s income is 140 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and she is doing it together with her husband. Fatma keeps a flock of sheep in her own yard. She fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Fatma is applying for a loan of 1800 AZN to buy 10 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer. She is optimistic about this loan, because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer.

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh is 34 years old and lives in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. He used to help his parents take care of livestock and produce organic dairy products and sell to local customers. He has a hearing disability and trained as a specialized cobbler in a specialized training course. Gansuh started his cobbler service business in 2012 right after he graduated the training course. He is now requesting 350,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to purchase inventory for running his cobbler service business. He is a welcoming, hardworking and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for running his cobbler service.

loans.name: Gotitas De Chocolate Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS DE CHOCOLATE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulema es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verdura, tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de joyas de fantasía.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zulema es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeras del grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de joyas de fantasía; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió con ayuda de sus padres quienes le dieron el capital para emprender este negocio y en  la actualidad le ayuda a al sustento de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de joyas de fantasía) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Gotitas de Chocolate community bank will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center.  The group has eight members and is led by an executive board of which Zulema is the president.  The businesses that the members have are varied and include vegetable sales, a neighborhood store, braiding blankets, fruit sales, and sales of costume jewelry.  

Zulema is one of the female small-business owners who will benefit from this loan.  She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of one of her friends in the group.  Currently she has a business selling costume jewelry.  She says she learned this business with the help of her parents, who gave her the capital to start the business and help her take care of her family.

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital and purchase costume jewelry from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  She will sell it at her sales location.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household since she has a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area.

loans.use: to purchase costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cereals and soft drinks at wholesale and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and a general store business. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more dried fish to sell to her community.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her community.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena, age 47, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers embroidery services which is the only source of income for his family. 

Zareena is requesting a loan, as a member of a two-persons lending group, from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase embroidery threads, needles, buttons of various colours and clothes for his business. This will help him to increase his sales and net income. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Zareena hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery threads, needles, buttons of various colours and clothes for her husband's business.

loans.name: Yessika

texts.es: Yessika nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión de libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de confección de prendas, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana, telas, hilos, agujas y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yessika was born in the city of Paucartambo, where she still lives with her family. She is 37 years old and is in a common-law marriage relationship from which she has two children. She is a hard working and enterprising person that helps her family get by with her efforts.

Her main economic activity is the sale of hand-made garments. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to join the "Señor de Coyllority" communal bank. With this opportunity she requests the loan in order to buy work materials such as wool, fabric, thread, needles and other things. She is thankful for and values the loan and commits to fulfilling her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase work materials such as wool, fabric, thread, and needles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y su madre, ella se dedica  a la venta de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, etc. vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y así poder ayudar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: This client lives in her own house with her husband and her mother. She sells perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, etc. as a street vendor in different neighborhoods close to her residence. With her earnings from her sales and with her husband's help, they are able to pay for some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more products wholesale to be able to continue with her business, which generates good income. This way, she can help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
El señor José Danilo de 32  años de edad el vive  con su espeso y su hijo en su casa de habitación ubicada en un caserío de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don José Danilo su negocio es la venta de  pan, agua y palomitas de maíz en las pulperías,  se transporta en su carro a los diferentes lugares donde hay negocios para ofrecer sus productos, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  pan, agua y palomitas de maíz al por mayor para revender. 
Don José Danilo con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener mejores utilidades que le ayuden a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de  su familia. 
Don José Danilo su sueño es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante  su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
José Danilo is 32 years old. He lives with hie wife and son in their house located in the community of  San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.
José Danilo's business is selling bread, water and popcorn in stores. He goes in his car to different places where there are businesses that can offer his products. He is asking for the loan to buy bread, water and popcorn to re-sell. 
 
With the help of the loan, José Danilo plans on improving his business and having more profits that will help him improve his and his family's quality of life a little. 

José Danilo's dream is to keep working and getting his family ahead.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, water and popcorn for his business.

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim is 51 years old and a widow with six children. Nowadays, she has two children to cater to as they are in school. She strives for a living via rice farming and animal husbandry. Engaged in the current business for 20 years, she is able to earn up to 12,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. This is not the first loan for Yim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful loan, which she has paid back, she was able to support her animal raising on time and renovate her house on time. 

For this loan cycle, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes to own a decent latrine for her family’s use to improve sanitation practices in her entire household.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: A villager from Samrong district of Takeo province, Khorn is the mother of two children. She earns a living through animal husbandry (cow,chicken) and threading the silk pattern for a fee whereas her husband is a motorbike repairer in the area. She has been involved in her current business for ten years. Khorn is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which she has fully repaid has enabled her to support her animal husbandry in a timely way and to make a decent profit to keep her kids in school. Now, in a group of three, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a proper latrine. She hopes this purchase will prevent her kids from getting relevant illnesses due to the lack of sanitation practice.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: Doña Maria es una madre soltera vive en casa propia, con su hijo de 24 años de edad el se dedica a la albañilería, Doña Maria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años,  tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy amable y dedicada a su trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su hijo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal  para la elaboración  de las tortillas y así mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su hijo.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her 24-year-old son, who is a bricklayer. Maria has been making and selling tortillas for several years. She has many customers because she is a very friendly person and is dedicated to her work. With the revenues she earns as well as with help from her son, they pay for some household expenses. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase corn wholesale and lime to make the tortillas and, thereby, improve her quality of life and have better financial stability for herself and her son.

loans.use: purchase corn wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce, leche, sopas y otra serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio y la ayuda de su esposo  han sacado adelante a su familia. La clienta  busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, aceite, sopas, etc. lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
The customer lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She owns a small store where she sells perishable goods like soft drinks, candies, sweets, milk, soups along with a series of other edible and non-edible articles. 

Through this business, with the assistance of her husband, she's helped her family get by. The customer seeks to improve her quality of life. Which is why she's requesting a loan in order to increase the variety of articles in her store such as basic grains, soft drinks, candies, oil, soups, etc. This will allow her to increase her business' profits and improve the quality of life of her family group.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, candies, oil, soups, etc.

loans.name: 7 Palmeras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 7 PALMERAS  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varon,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Dadny en la foto (la del centro con polera a rayas celeste y azul) tiene 31 años, tiene un hijito d ela edad de 9 años que se encuentra en edad escolar, La Sra.  Dadny se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de desayunos ella vende café y empanadas de manera ambulante por la zona donde ella vive, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, utilizara el crédito en la  compra de harina  para la elaboración de empanadas,  y también para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de desayunos como azúcar y harina, café y distintos mates por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: The entrepreneurs' bank of 7 Palmeras is formed of nine members: eight women and one man. The president of the bank is Dadny. In the photo, she is in the center with the striped light and dark blue polo shirt. She is 31 years old. She has one little boy who is nine years old and is of school age. Dadny makes and sells breakfasts. She sells coffee and empanadas on the street in the area where she lives. This is her first loan cycle with this institution. She will use the loan to purchase flour for making empanadas as well as to purchase wholesale ingredients for making the breakfasts, such as sugar and flour, coffee, and certain sauces. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because this is the only work that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make breakfasts.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta ropa, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como camisas, pantalones, blusas y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Miriam was born in the city of Paucartambo, and she lives with her family in the same city. She is 36 years old and is married, and through this beautiful marriage she has four children. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial person who moves forward with her family through the effort of her work. Her main business activity is selling clothes. She is a responsible person, and this is why they invited her to participate in the Señor de Coyllority communal bank. For this opportunity she needs a loan to purchase clothes such as shirts, pants, blouses, and other additional items. She is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothes such as shirts, pants, blouses, and other additional items.

loans.name: Carlos Jesus

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura, en especial los cultivos de uva, algodón, entre otros. Carlos es un joven con muchas gnas de salir adelante, es por ello que a pesar de las adversidades se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma. Para poder solventar sus estudios trabaja como obreras en un fundo agrícola de su distrito. Carlos cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobretodo quiere ser un profesional para poder apoyar a su familia.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar algunos gastos de sus estudios como materiales, uniformes, pasajes y algunos pagos que tiene que realizar a su universidad, de esta manera el seguirá estudiando y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser un gran profesional y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young, 22-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago, which is characterized by developing itself in agriculture, especially for crops of grapes, cotton, etc. Carlos is a young person with great hopes of succeeding; this is why, despite of all the adversities he faces, he is studying agricultural engineering. To be able to pay for his studies, he works as a staff member for an agricultural fund in his district. Carlos believes that he is moving forward because he is responsible and, above all, he wants to be a professional in order to be able to support his family.

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to pay for some school-related expenses, such as materials, uniforms, transportation, and some fees he has to pay at his university. This way, he will continue studying and will be able to continue fighting to bring his greatest dream into reality: to be a great businessman and be able to support his family.

loans.use: purchase materials and pay school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Fehmar

texts.en:
Fehmar is 34 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Fehmar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Fehmar has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Fehmar would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselda

texts.en:
Roselda is 44 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Roselda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Roselda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Papitas De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PAPITAS DE SENKATA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cecilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de enaguas, producción de mantas de vicuña, librería, venta de api, venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de carne de cerdo

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cecilia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de enaguas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió cuando ayudaba a su madre al negocio familiar posteriormente decide establecer su negocio independiente y en la actualidad trabaja con sus hijas a quienes también enseñó el mismo oficio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente ala  elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito,  ahorro y el área de salud.

Al grupo acompaña la hija de una de las integrantes ella esta vcestida de negro.
texts.en:
The Papitas de Senkata communal bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Main Focus of Senkata. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors for which Cecilia is president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are skirt-weaving, making llama blankets, a bookstore, selling api (a maize drink), selling food, selling fish, and selling pork.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses, such as Cecilia's. She says that the first time she came to Pro Mujer, she was joining at the invitation of her friends who are members of the group. Now she has a business weaving and selling skirts. We have come to understand that she learned this business when she used to help her mother with the family business. Later, she decided to start her own business, and now she works with her daughters, and she is teaching them the same trade.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase capital to purchase wool, which she will purchase from wholesale stores in the city of La Paz and later make to sell by order. This type of work allows her to generate revenue to support her family because she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loan, saving, and the health program.

The group is accompanied by the daughter of one of the members; she is dressed in black (in the photo).

loans.use: purchase wool.

loans.name: Oscar Isidro

texts.es: Don Oscar de 38 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa  y sus dos hijas de 11 y 9 años de edad quienes estudian  actualmente, es muy responsable y tiene como prioridad sacar adelante a sus dos hijas. Don oscar tiene un negocio de reparación  y venta de relojes desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy solicitada por sus  clientes pues es muy honesto en su trabajo,  además es una persona muy emprendedora y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos de sus gastos. Oscar  solicita un crédito para la compra de relojes, baterías para reloj y  brazaletes para atender mejor a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias y así  mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is 38 years old and lives in the house of a relative with his wife and two children. They are aged 11 and 9 years old and they go to school. Oscar is very responsible and getting his children ahead is his priority. For the past number of years his business has been repairing and selling watches. His stall is located close to his residence. He is sought out by his customers as he is very honest in his work. Moreover he is a very enterprising person and with his income he has managed to pay off some of his expenses. Oscar is asking for this loan in order to buy watches, watch straps and batteries, to take better care of his customers, increase his profits and raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy watches and watch batteries and straps.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Ayde, de 33 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de su esposo en su casa propia. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la comercialización de menestras, los cuales le otorgan un ingreso semanal y constante. Antes gustaba de la siembra, comenta que no deja de hacerlo pero solo para su propio consumo, ya que existen varios que se dedican a esa actividad. Ella no quiere ser una más, por eso emprendió este negocio nuevo y de ganancias estables. Ahora desea comprar un lugar estable en una zona de comercio para poder negociar sus menestras a buen precio y proyectarse a ser una empresaria mayorista. “Esa es mi meta, espero conseguirlo con el apoyo de mi esposo y mi familia”, afirma. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA,y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Ayde, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de menestras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ayde is an independent woman who is 33 years old. She lives with her husband in their own house. Her principal source of revenue comes from selling legumes, beans, peas etc., which gives her a constant weekly income. Before this she liked to plant food. She still does this but only for her own household consumption. As many people do this for a living, she didn't want to be just one more. So she started this new business with it's stable revenues. Now she wishes to buy a regular place in the marketplace to sell her product at a good price and one day become a wholesaler. "That is my goal, I hope to attain it with the help of my husband and family" she affirmed. 

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the assistance she has received so she can get ahead. And she promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner. Ayde will invest the 500 PEN buying legumes, beans and peas.

loans.use: to buy legumes, beans and peas wholesale.

loans.name: Chamampi Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAMANPI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ollas, tejido de mantas, carpintero, venta de mantas, producción de puertas, venta de papa, cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de mantas bordadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió a muy corta edad, aprendiendo la técnica en un taller donde era operaria, posteriormente decide implementar su taller propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ceda) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The Chamampi Sartasiñani Communal Bank is entering its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Regional Office.  It is made up of eight members and it is governed by a board of directors, the president of which is Elsa.  The communal bank members do different types of work, such as selling pots, weaving blankets, carpentry, selling blankets, making doors, selling potatoes, and locksmithing.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesswomen, one of which is Elsa.  She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer nine years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business weaving and selling embroidered blankets.  She also tells us that she started this business when she was very young, learning her technique in a workshop where she was employed and later deciding to start her own shop.

The loan she is currently taking out is to increase her capital to buy silk, which she will get from distributors wholesale and which she will then embroider and sell at her shop.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with five children. 
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy silk

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 64 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposo Julián, con quien convive desde hace 40 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Julia se dedica a la ganadería. Ella comenzó hace 20 años en está actividad,  la crianza de vacas.
