loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.es:
Lurdes, de 29 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer dedicada y con muchas actividades. Durante las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de los niños de su pueblo trabajando en un programa social del estado, donde recibe un sueldo mensual, ya por las tardes vende productos comestibles en una pequeña tienda que acondicionó en su casa, donde además vende bebidas de toda clase y tipo, siendo este su principal ingreso económico pues tiene mucha clientela que consumen de manera constante y mucho más los fines de semana.Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente feliz por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual todas sus cuotas.
Lurdes, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de bebidas al por mayor para su venta.
texts.en:
Lurdes, 29, is a modest person who lives with her husband and their two children in their own home.  She is a dedicated woman who is very busy.  In the morning she takes care of the children in her village through a state social program, earning a monthly salary.  In the afternoon she sells groceries at the small store she set up in her home.  She also sells all kinds of soft drinks, which is her main source of income.  She has many customers all the time and even more on the weekends.  

This is her second Kiva loan and she is excited about receiving support so she can continue getting ahead.  Also, she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

Lurdes will use the 1,000 PEN to buy soft drinks wholesale.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Luz De Maria

texts.es: Luz de 36 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 7 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de su residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que hay su casa, Luz  solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
Luz is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children. She has had a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers for seven years. She has a good customer base because she sells her food at a good price. Her business is located near her home. 

With her earnings, she helps out with the household expenses. Luz is requesting a loan to enable her to buy everything she needs to make her sandwiches and hamburgers, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadela, and other ingredients. This will allow her to boost her income and continue helping out at home with any expenses that may arise.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadela, etc.

loans.name: Las Carabuqueñas Y Cariñosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CARABUQUEÑAS Y CARIÑOSAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y sus suegros, ya que este es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la renovación de herramientas (compra de red) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS CARABUQUEÑAS Y CARIÑOSAS” is beginning its first cycle with the field partner through the field partner’s Achacachi regional office. This group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Rosa is the secretary. The businesses of the members are varied and include growing and selling potatoes and other vegetables, a neighborhood store, making potato flour and cattle sales.

The loan will be used in some small businesses of which Rosa is a member. Rosa says that this is the first time she has joined the field partner, and that she joined at the invitation of a representative of the field partner that came to visit her in her home. Rosa currently has a business selling fish. She says that she learned this business from her parents and her in-laws and that it is a family business.

Rosa will use this loan to replace some of the tools she uses in her business, such as buying new fishing net. She will buy the fishing net in the markets of the city of El Alto and then install it in the stall where she sells her fish. She says that her business allows her to earn income to pay for as many of her household expenses as possible. Rosa is married and has four children.

Asked what she likes about the field partner, Rosa says that she likes the training programs that deal with health and with credit.

loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, de 28 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive desde hace 2 años en una casa alquilada junto a su hija pequeña. Sus comienzos no fueron fáciles, ella trabajó mucho para ahorrar el dinero necesario, para abrir su propio negocio, siempre tubo en mente una jugueria, pues en la ciudad no hay una, cuando abrió hace 6 años no tenía competencia, vendía muy bien, en todo ese tiempo pudo ahorrar y comprar más cosas para su negocio, como sillas, vasos y licuadora y demás adornos para su local, “de esa manera se estaría más elegante y confortable”, pensó. Ahora cuenta con varias juguerias a su alrededor, pero como ella es antigua en el negocio tiene su clientela ganada, por ello no se desanima, al contrario desea seguir mejorando en la atención, ahora ya cuenta con señoritas que le ayudan en la atención. Este es su segundo crédito con KIva, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Sarita, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de frutas como plátanos, papaya, por cajones y si el dinero le alcanza remodelará su juguería con nuevas sillas.
texts.en:
Sarita, 28, is a hard-working woman who has lived with her daughter for two years in a rented house.  Her beginnings were not easy and she had to work long hours to save enough money to open her own business.  She always had in mind a juice business because there was not one in her city.  When she opened for business six years ago, she had no competition at all and sold very well.  In that time she was able to save up and buy more items for her business such as chairs, cups, a juice machine and other decorations for her shop.  "That makes it more elegant and comfortable.", she believed.

Now there are several juice bars nearby, but since she has been in business the longest she enjoys a loyal clientele and does not get discouraged.  Quite the contrary, she wants to continue improving her customer service and employs young women to help out.  

This her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support because it will allow her to earn more income.  She is committed to paying the loan back on time.

Sarita will use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy fruits such as bananas and papaya by the crate; and if there is any money left over she will buy new chairs to remodel her juice bar.

loans.use: To buy fruits such as bananas, papayas, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, de 59 años es un hombre fuerte y soltero. Vive en compañía de sus padres a los que cuida en la casa que compraron hace 48 años aproximadamente. El trabajo al que se dedica este hombre trabajador es el servicio de reciclaje. En un espacio que acondicionó en la casa de sus padres almacena las botellas y los papeles que todos los días recoge de las calles de la ciudad. “Las personas no están acostumbradas a reciclar por lo que las calles están llenas de productos que se pueden utilizar”, es así que su trabajo comienza en las noches hasta el primer rayo de sol, “en las noches recojo todo lo que dejaron del día, en los restaurantes, hoteles, en las calles y las diversas instituciones públicas y privadas donde me regalan el papel que botan a la basura, todo esto me sirve para reciclar”, comenta. Cuando tiene un número considerable de productos reciclables los comercializa a un empresa especializada, donde le pagan por kilos. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Javier, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en el trasporte de las cosas que recicla, además de comprar productos de limpieza para lavar las botellas recicladas.
texts.en:
Javier, age 59, is a strong man who is single. He lives with his parents and looks after them in the house that they purchased approximately 48 years ago. His work consists of providing recycling services. In a space set aside in his parents’ house, Javier stores bottles and paper that he collects every day off of the streets of the city. “People are not accustomed to recycling since the streets are full of products that can be used,” he says. Javier begins his work at night and ends at sunrise. “At night I collect everything that is left out during the day whether it is at restaurants, hotels, on the streets, or at various public and private institutions. They give me paper that is thrown out as trash and everything else that can be recycled,” he explains. When he has a considerable amount of recyclable products stocked up, he sells them to a specialty company that pays by the kilo.

This is his second Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support he has received. In addition, he promises to be punctual with his loan payments. Javier will invest 1,000 PEN in the cost of transporting these recyclable materials as well as cleaning products for washing the recyclable bottles.

loans.use: to pay the cost of transporting recyclable materials and to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Don Juan posee un taller de estructuras metálicas desde hace varios años donde de dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos metálicos como: puertas, balcones, ventanas, techos, etc. es una persona responsable y emprendedora, posee muchos clientes gracias a su excelente trabajo y honestidad con la que labora. Don Juan solicita un crédito para invertir en la comprar de materiales como hierro, lamina, varillas, herramientas, etc. para seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Juan, 38, lives in his own home with his wife and two children.  He has been in the metal carpentry business for several year and makes all kinds of metal products such as doors, balconies, windows, roofing, etc.  He is a responsible, enterprising person who has many customers because of his excellent work and ethics.  

Juan is requesting a loan to buy materials such as iron, sheeting, rods, tools, etc. to continue with his business so he can provide for his family with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: To buy iron, sheeting, rods, tools, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Santos  tiene 30 años el se dedica a la venta  de madera y producción de carbón desde hace ya varios años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también se dedicaba a la producción de carbón, el tiene su parcela que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Santo Corazón, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Santos  utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de moto sierras para cortar  madera para la producción de carbón, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de estas herramientas de trabajo, ya que esto no le permite cortar en mayor cantidad, El Sr. Santos  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, , ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Don Santos is 30, owns a plot of land in the town of Santo Corazón, and has for several years run a business selling wood and producing charcoal. He learned this business from his father, who also produced charcoal. This is Don Santos's first loan with this institution and he plans to use the loan funds to purchase a chainsaw for cutting wood for charcoal production. Santos is applying for a loan because he lacks capital to purchase tools and the ones he has don't allow him to cut enough wood. Don Santos faces challenges in his business and rising out of poverty, so he'll use the loan funds to improve his and his family's quality of life. Don Santos's business is the family's only means of support, so he is grateful to the institution and the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase a chainsaw.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María Teodora ,  de 50  años de edad es soltera, tiene  02 hijos  que depende de ella,  vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 13 años  al negocio de venta de tajadas de plátano verde para las pulpería y mercadito.
Doña María Teodora  también vende tortillas y sus clientes le prefieren por su puntualidad en su entrega de los pedidos, es una mujer sola que ha tenido que luchar junto con sus hijos para sacar adelante a la familia.
Doña María Teodora  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de plátanos que son la materia prima, leña, aceites y maíz, que necesita para seguir trabajando en su taller de tajadas de plátano y tortillas.
Doña María Teodora  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y obtener mejores ganancia que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña María Teodora  su sueño es tener un buen negocio y mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
María Teodora, 50, is single and has two dependent children.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras, in her own home.  For 13 years she has been in the business of selling green banana chips for grocery stores and the market.

María Teodora also sells tortillas, and her customers prefer her because she delivers orders on time.  As a single woman she has had to work hard together with her children to provide for the family.  She is requesting a loan to buy bananas as raw material, firewood, oil and corn.  This is so she can continue with her banana chip and tortillas business.

With the support of the loan she hopes to improve her work conditions and improve her profits so her family can have a better quality of life.  María Teodora's goal is to have a successful business and renovate her home.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2013.

loans.use: To buy bananas, firewood, oil and corn for her business.

loans.name: Deysi Roxana

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Durán.  Decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque necesitaba dinero para sus estudios y para ello necesitaba urgentemente de un ingreso.  Labora sola, por la mañana y la tarde.  Está separada de su esposo y tiene un hijo que estudia en la escuela fiscal.  Sueña en un futuro poder tener su casa propia.  Por ahora necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar una computadora que le ayude en las labores escolares a su hijo.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Durán. She decided to start a business because she needed money for her studies as well as an immediate source of income. She works alone in the mornings and in the afternoons. The borrower is separated from her husband and has a child who is attending a state school. In the future, she dreams of having a house of her own.

For now, the borrower needs the money from this loan so that she can buy a computer that will help her son with his schoolwork.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her son.

loans.name: Santos Rosa

texts.es: Santos tiene 39 años y vive con su esposa en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca cultiva granos básicos para autoconsumo, y café como principal fuente de sus ingresos desde hace más de 10 años. La producción promedio de café en su finca en los últimos años ha sido de 55 quintales de café pergamino por manzana. Para este ciclo está solicitado un crédito para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a su cafetal e incrementar los rendimientos. El crédito lo estaría invirtiendo en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para su café. Su meta es continuar mejorando sus plantaciones mediante la implementando las buenas prácticas agrícolas y demás criterios que son exigidos por los procesos de certificación en los cuales participa, como el de Comercio Justo.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old and lives with his wife in a community in northern Nicaragua. On his small farm, he grows basic grains for personal consumption and coffee as his main source of income. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. The average coffee production on his farm within the past few years has been 55 quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of coffee beans in parchment per 1.74 acres of land.

For this crop cycle, Santos is requesting a loan so that he can provide adequate maintenance for his coffee crops and increase his yield. The loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers for his coffee plants. His goal is to continue improving his crops by implementing good farming practices and meeting the criteria that is required for becoming a certified Fair Trade grower.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Lab's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Srey Snom district, Lab is a 50-year-old mother of four children. The main sources of her family’s income are growing rice and cassava. Having been in this business for 32 years, Lab and her husband are able to earn about KHR 25,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Lab with VisionFund Cambodia. Now she is requesting a group loan. As the leader of Lab's Group, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more crop yield, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia es un persona muy trabajadora y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la compra y venta de buche de pescado desde hace 5 años, los  cuales vende desde su casa de habitación donde llegan sus clientes.
Doña Lesbia su negocio es muy conocido en la comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser buche de pescado, babosa, curvina, anguila, pancha, etc. que necesita para la cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes. 
Doña Lesbia espera que  el  préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a podrá contar con el producto necesario para satisfacer los pedidos y necesidades de sus clientes, además espera que sus ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de su familia. 
Doña Lesbia su sueño es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Junio 2013
texts.en:
Lesbia is a very hardworking and honest person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her spouse and their two children. She has had a business buying and selling fish maw for the last five years. Her customers come to her home, where she sells them her products.

Lesbia's business is very well known in the community. She is asking for this loan to buy more products, like fish maw, sea slugs, silver perch, eel, bluegill fish, etc., that she needs to fill her customers' orders.

Lesbia hopes that the loan will help her a lot, because she will have enough stock to fill her orders and meet the needs of her clients, thanks to this loan. In addition, she hopes that her sales will increase. This way, she will make more earnings, leading to improvements in her family's lifestyle.

Lesbia's dream is to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - June of 2013.

loans.use: to buy fish maw, sea slugs, silver perch, eel, bluegill fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 26 years old and married, with one child, two years old. She runs a wood business in Tombo, a western, rural area in Freetown. She started the business because she wanted to get her daily bread.  

She's been in this business since 2005 and sells wood at her house.  She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more wood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to change her business, to open a big grocery shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Dairo De Jesús

texts.es: Dairo es un hombre de 28 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos de 7 y 2 años. Nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias al lado de su padre. Actualmente se dedica a laborar en una empresa cultivadora, desempeñando el cargo de operario agrícola, desde hace 4 años alterna su trabajo con la ganadería de levante, actividad que inició gracias a créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Su ganado incluye una vaca productora de leche, cuyo líquido producido diariamente, es vendido entre amigos, familiares y vecinos de la vereda donde reside; de esta manera obtiene los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia. Dairo es un hombre activo, juicioso, trabajador y siempre tiene una actitud positiva frente a la vida, así, ha sobrepadado diversos obstáculos externos que se le presentan, por ejemplo las situaciones difíciles originadas por los altos costos del concetrado para los animales (cuido); esto lo anima aún más para solicitar apoyo del tercer crédito con el que desea comprar ganado de levante (una ternera) con el fin de continuar con su negocio y poder seguir creciendo económicamente para brindarle a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Dairo is a 28-year-old man. He is married and the father of 2 children, ages 7 and 2. Dairo was born and raised in the countryside, where he learned agricultural work alongside his father. Now he works in a cultivation business as an agricultural operator. For four years, he has alternated his work with raising livestock, an activity which started thanks to previous loans. His has a milking cow, whose daily milk is sold among friends, family, and neighbors in the village where he lives. In this way he makes enough money to be able to support his family. Dairo is an active, judicious, hard-working man, and he always has a positive outlook on life. Because of this, he has overcome diverse external obstacles that have challenged him, such as the difficult situations caused by the high costs of caring for the animals. This inspires him even more to apply for a third loan. With this loan, he hopes to buy cattle to raise (a calf) so that he can continue his business and be able to continue its economic growth to offer his children a better education and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise (a calf).

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, de 46 años es una mujer que lucha por el futuro de sus hijos. Vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Dolores se dedica a la ganadería y la venta de comidas, por eso prepara los alimentos para luego venderlos a los pobladores quienes conocen su buena sazón. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, tanto así que hace poco comenzó a preparar jugos de diversas frutas. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ya tiene 3 vacas y 2 becerros, de los que prepara queso pequeño o llamados “bolillos”, que después lo comercializa en la ciudad más cercana, cuando es día de feria. Ahora desea seguir trabajando con más empeño pues, desea contar con un capital de trabajo sólido, que no le cause dificultades. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Dolores, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa que le sirve de alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en: Dolores is a 46-year-old woman who fights for the future of her children. She lives together with her spouse and their 5 children in their own house. Dolores raises livestock and sells food. She prepares the food to later sell it to the people who are familiar with its good taste. Her work is going very well, so well that she recently began making various fruit juices. But since Dolores is a hard-working woman, she also raises cattle. She already has 3 cows and 2 calves, which allows her to make small cheeses called “bolillos.” Later, she sells these in the nearest city on market day. Now, Dolores wants to continue working harder and to have a solid income without difficulties. This is Dolores’s second loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for all the financial support that she receives to continue moving ahead. She promises to make her monthly payment on time. Dolores will invest the 800 Peruvian Soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish the alfalfa crops that she uses to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to grow food for her animals.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Isha from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with one child, aged 10 years. In 2010, Isha established her home product business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support her home. She works at the business ten hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isha requires a loan to buy a greater variety of pans, plates and cups. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and renovate her house. In the future, Isha plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of pans, plates and cups.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 47 years old and married, with four children between 10 and 25 years. She runs a general merchandise business in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business because she wants to strive for herself and for her family's welfare.

She's been in this business since 2006 and sells toothpaste, cigarettes and soap within her community. She says that her main challenge is lack of enough capital to expand her business.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more toothpaste, cigarettes and soap for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more toothpaste, cigarettes and soap for resale.

loans.name: Pentalfa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PENTALFA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erika es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos de limpieza, venta de medicina natural, venta de zapatillas, venta de cosméticos, venta de CD’s, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erika es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos naturales; este negocio lo emprendió bajo el asesoramiento de una tía que realizaba la misma actividad, en la actualidad es un buen negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de medicina natural) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y apoya económicamente a su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. “PENTALFA” will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Villa Tejada. It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of officers, of which Ms. Erika is the president. The members of the communal bank have various businesses: selling cleaning products, natural medicine, shoes, cosmetics, CDs, and groceries.

The loan will benefit the group of small microbusinesses where Ms. Erika is a member. It has been a year since she joined Pro Mujer because she was invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling natural products. She opened this business under the advice of her aunt who did the same activity. It is a good business now.
 
The loan that Dolores is taking out now is to buy natural medicine. She hopes to increase the money that she will make by selling the medicine at the markets in El Alto and later in her own shop. This kind of work allows her to generate revenue to maintain her home, since she is single and also supports her mother. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Erika responds that she likes the trainings on credit and health.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Techology

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her brother's tuition cost at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her nephew's secondary school tuition costs at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her daughter's secondary school tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his nephew's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 56 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Marcos el menor de sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Nació en la comunidad nativa donde vive y donde crió y miró nacer a sus hijos. Maria se dedica a la artesanía, sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que hoy sabe y lo que pone en práctica en su comunidad. Recibe muchos turistas durante todo el año es así que sus conocimientos le ayudan a ganarse la vida y hacer de esto una actividad económica. Elabora artesanía con los productos naturales de la zona, como es la corteza del coco, las semillas de las plantas y demás productos con los que elabora hermososa cortinas, además de medicinas naturales para aliviar distintas enfermedades. Tiene clientes de todas partes del país que la visitan constantemente, además de brindarle recreación con los paisajes de su comunidad. Ahora desea elaborar más artesanía para abastecer la demanda de turistas a nivel nacional e internacional. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos.
María, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de accesorios, además de hilos e instrumentos para elaborar la artesanía.
texts.en:
María, 56 years old, is a simple woman.  She lives with Marcos, the youngest of her 5 children, in her own home.  She was born in the native community where she lives, and where she watched her children being born and raised.

María makes her living in handicrafts.  Her parents taught her everything she knows today and that she puts into practice in her community.  She receives a lot of tourists throughout the year.  This is how her knowledge helps her to earn a living and turn this into a business.

She makes handicrafts with natural products from the area, like coconut bark, the seeds of plants and other products with which she makes beautiful curtains, as well as natural medicines to relieve various illnesses.

She has customers from all over the country who visit her constantly, and also enjoy the landscapes of her community.  Now, she wishes to make more handicrafts in order to meet the tourist demand at national and international levels.  

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support.  She also promises to be punctual with her payments, as with previous loans.  María will invest the 2000 soles in the purchase of accessories, as well as threads and tools for making the handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy accessories, threads and tools for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, de 31 años; está casada con Javier y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Nilda se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de cuyes,comenzó sembrando alverja pero actualmente tambien siembra lechuga, hortalizas, alfalfa y papa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo se encuentra en la época de cosecha, ya que ve concretizado todo su esfuerzo en la venta de sus alimentos en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, además del cuidado de sus animales pues tiene cuyes y ovejas a los que alimenta con sus propios cultivos. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de su siembra y así obtener el capital necesario para abrir una tienda de comestibles en su localidad. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Nilda, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de hortalizas y alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Nilda, 31 years old, is married to Javier and has 3 children, with whom she lives in her own home.  Nilda makes a living in agriculture and raising guinea pigs. She started out planting peas, but now she also plants lettuce, vegetables, alfalfa and potatoes.

What she likes most about her work is during harvest season, because she can see the concrete results of her efforts in the sale of her foodstuffs at the wholesale market in her city, and also in the care of her animals, because she has guinea pigs and sheep that she feeds with her own crops.

Now she wishes to improve the quality of her planting, and thus obtain the necessary capital to open a grocery store in her neighborhood.  This is her fourth Kiva loan, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments in a timely fashion.

Nilda will invest the 3000 soles in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her planted fields of vegetables and alfalfa to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia, de 65 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía del menor de  sus 5 hijos, en su casa propia. Zenobia se dedica a la agricultura, a pesar de su edad continua con la siembra de alverja, papa, maíz y algunas verduras, y dice que le gusta mucho su labor porque trabaja al lado de su hijo, y juntos vigilan sus cultivos. Dice que la recompensa a su labor constante la observa durante la época de cosecha, pues obtiene buenos ingresos durante la comercialización de sus productos. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces cuando no les brinda un tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, se infectan con plagas y recuerda con tristeza como alguna  vez perdió casi toda su producción, pero con la experiencia que le dio la vida, continúa trabajando. Además de tener 5 vacas grandes y 3 pequeñas que le proporcionan la leche con lo que hace queso. Según cuenta vende 15 moldes a la semana, ahí obtiene una ganancia extra. Ella es muy feliz y desea seguir trabajando en el campo el resto de su vida. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, donde promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Zenovia, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Zenovia, 65, lives in her own home along with the youngest of her 5 children.  She is a farmer who, in spite of her age, continues to cultivate peas, potatoes, corn and some vegetables.   She says that she likes her work a lot, because she works alongside her son, and they care for the crops together.  She says that the reward for her constant work is seen in the harvest season, as she gets a good income from selling her products.  What she dislikes about her work is that often, when she doesn't provide adequate treatment to her crops, they get infested with pests.  She remembers with sadness how she once lost almost all of her production.  But with the experience that life has given her she continues to work.  In addition, she has 5 large cows and 3 small ones that provide her with milk, which she uses to make cheese.  She says that she sells 15 cheese molds a week to obtain additional earnings.  

Zenovia is very happy, and she wants to continue to work the land for the rest of her life.  This is her 4th loan with Kiva, and she promises to make her payments on time.  In addition, she is very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to help her get ahead.  Zenovia will invest the 1,500 Peruvian soles she receives in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one pig breeding.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es: El señor Ananias,  de 47 años de edad, tiene tres  hijos dependientes, su esposa le colabora en la producción agrícola liderando el manejo de la familia. En el lugar donde vive por las bajas temperaturas que presenta la zona solo llegan a producir papa, quinua y trigo y durante estos días  por los cambios climatológicos, en su comunidad cayo una fuerte granizada la cual destruyo gran parte de su producción de papa , afectando sus ingresos económicos, esta granizada no solo causo daños en su producción sino que también afecto de gran manera la humilde casita donde viven, teniendo que dormir en casa de sus vecinos hasta refaccionar su vivienda,  el señor Ananias  está solicitando el crédito para comprar  semillas  y abonos para volver a sembrar en sus tierras ya que es la única fuente de ingresos económicos que tiene, este crédito ayudara mucho al señor Ananias y toda su familia puesto que a pesar  de todas estas inclemencias que sufrió el quiere sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ananias, 47 years of age, has three dependent children.  His wife supports him in agricultural production, heading up the management of the family.  

In the place where he lives, because of the low temperatures they get in the region, they can only grow potatoes, quinoa and wheat.  

In recent days, because of the changes in weather, his community got a strong hailstorm that destroyed a big part of his potato crop, affecting his income.  This hailstorm not only caused damage to his crop, but also had a great impact on his humble house where they live.  They have had to sleep at their neighbor's house until they can repair their home.

Ananias is applying for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to sow his lands again, since it is the only source of income he has.  This loan will help Ananias and his whole family a lot, since in spite of all this inclement weather that he has suffered, he wants to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris labora como enfermera en un centro hospitalario, ha puesto mucho empeño en reparar su vivienda, aún debe solucionar problemas de filtración de agua en el techo, poner canoas reparar el piso y hacer otros arreglos, para esto está solicitando un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000) con este dinero comprará los materiales y pagará mano de obra, manifiesta estar muy feliz con esta oportunidad de financiamiento.
texts.en: Doris works as a nurse in a medical center.  She has put a lot of effort into repairing her home, but she still needs to address problems having to do with water leaking through her roof; she needs to install gutters, repair the floor, and do other repairs.  To do this, she is requesting 1,040,000 Costa Rican colones so that she can buy materials and pay for labor.  She states that she is very happy with this opportunity to obtain financing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 27-year-old married man from Khan Yunes near Rafah city. He lives in a humble house with his wife and two kids - a boy and a girl. Waleed works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income. His income barely covers the family's needs. Waleed would like to improve his house and buy all the necessary home appliances.

Waleed is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy needed home appliances like a refrigerator to replace an old one. This will improve his family's living conditions.

Waleed would like to take a bigger loan in the future and buy all the needed stuff for his family. Waleed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy needed home appliances like a refrigerator to replace an old one

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Suya tiene una edad de 39 años es casada madre de 6 hijos los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo y ayudan en las diferentes actividades del campo como: limpieza, corte, recolección, fumigación, etc. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora dedicándose a realizar esta actividad desde hace muchos años ya que en compañía de sus padres ella aprendió a cultivar y sembrar el café siendo esta actividad fuente de ingresos para su familia en ese tiempo y hoy en día no es la excepción ya que es una tradición familiar. La tierra que en familia trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a una distancia de 1 kilómetro al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para su mantenimiento. 

Previniendo que sus cultivos sean dañados y afectados por la roya/plagas ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para proteger sus cultivos ya que estos son la única fuente de ingresos para su familia y hogar.  

Como madre de familia su sueño es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con carreras universitarias que ayuden a su desarrollo y aprendizaje ya que de esa manera ellos podrán enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Suya is 39 years old, married, and the mother of six children who live with her. They all help in the different farming tasks like clearing, pruning, harvesting, fumigating, etc. She is a housewife and farmer and she has made her living at this for many years. She first learned to plant and cultivate coffee from her parents as it was their main source of income at the time and remains so. It is a family tradition.The family owns the land they work, which is located a kilometer away from them. They walk there everyday to work maintaining the land.

Given that her crops have been effected and damaged by coffee rust and vermin, Suya is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL in order to protect her crops because they are her only source of income for her family and home. As the mother of the family, her dream is to see her children with a better quality of life. She wants to see them with university degrees that will help their development and experience. In this way they will be able to confront financial difficulties better.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 39-year-old single man from Qalqilia city. He is a worker with a low wage. Ahmad lives with his family in an old house. He would like to improve the house and renew some stuff like tiles and repair the water pipes and electricity wires. So, Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This will offer his family more comfortable living conditions.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials like tiles

loans.name: Alaa El Din

texts.en:
Alaa El Din is a 30-year-old married man from Jenin city. He has a carpentry shop in the city where he makes wooden furniture of a very good quality. He sells it to local retailers inside and outside Jenin. Alaa lives in a rental house now and would like to complete his new home so that he and his wife can live in it.

Alaa is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy necessary construction materials like tiles and electrical wires. This will help him to finish his home and live in it as soon as possible.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials like tiles and electrical wires

loans.name: 3.12.316.8.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Lan works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lan is 24 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.12.316.8.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of six members. Lan supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in her business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.2.313.1.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Ngợi has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Ngợi is 27 years old and she is married with no children. She is the group leader of the 3.2.313.1.Thiệu Vận  solidarity group, which consists of three members. Ngợi lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Ngợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngợi has been involved in her business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngợi hopes to remodel her house, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods to sell.

loans.name: 3.2.314.5.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Thu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Thu is 46 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 3.2.314.5.Thiệu Vận  solidarity group, which consists of three members.  Thu lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, and she has three dependents

In 2005, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.12.315.6.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Bôn works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Bôn is 44 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 3.12.315.6.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of four members. Bôn supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province; her two other children are grown up.

In 2010, Bôn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bôn has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bôn hopes for her children to find good jobs, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.14.318.1.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt has a manufacturing business making wood furniture. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood for woodworking.

Nguyệt is 32 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 3.14.318.1.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of five members. Nguyệt supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in her business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nguyệt hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood for woodworking.

loans.name: 3.14.317.1.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ngoan runs a business taking photographs. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain her photography shop. Ngoan is 35 years old and is married with two children. She is the leader of the 3.14.317.1.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. Ngoan supports two dependents with her business in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2011, Ngoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngoan has successfully repaid two loans. She has been involved in her business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital. With her business profits, Ngoan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain a photography shop.

loans.name: 3.13.322.4.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Hoa works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hoa is 47 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 3.13.322.4.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 8 members.  Hoa lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.  She has no dependent because her children are grown up.

In 2010, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  Hoa has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: buy poultry

loans.name: 3.13.326.6.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Loan operates a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer and snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain her refreshment bar (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drink, fast food, etc.)

Loan is 24 years old and she is married with 1 child.  She is the group leader of the 3.13.326.6.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Loan supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Loan has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Loan hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: by supplies for her refreshment bar

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells rice cake, “puto” and “bibingka”  in her village. She is able to earn PHP 200-300 daily if she makes more delicacies.  Rebecca wants to increase her income, for this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy milk, sugar, malagkit rice. She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well, to gain a higher income and save some of it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: 08-02-09 -Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Bằng operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodle. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make food to resell. 

Bằng is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 04-08-02-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  Bằng lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

This is Bằng first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main harship that Bằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: 3.14.319.2.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Gái works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock and cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Gái is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children.  Gái is the group leader of the 3.14.319.2.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of 6 members.  Gái has no dependent and lives in in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  All her children are grown up.

In 2011, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.   Gái has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Gái hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: buy livestock and cattle

loans.name: 3.14.320.10.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock and cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Liên is 34 years old and she is married with 3 children.  She is the group leader of the 3.14.320.10.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of 5 members.   Liên supports 3 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Liên has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: buy livestock and cattle

loans.name: 3.13.321.5.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Liên is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 3.13.321.5.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Liên supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province, her other child is grown up.

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  Liên has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.   One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her family, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: buy poultry

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel trabaja dando mantenimiento a varios jardines de la localidad, con esfuerzo propio ha logrado avanzar en la construción de su vivienda , pero necesita terminar el cuarto de pilas, pisos, baños y otros detalles antes de que lleguen los meses más fuertes de la época lluviosa. Necesita un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar madera, zinc y otros materiales para poder terminar, con este préstamo espera resolver este problema y vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Israel works maintaining several gardens in the area.  Through his own effort he has managed to move forward with building his home, but he needs to finish the sink room, floors, and bathrooms before the rainy season.

He needs a loan for 1,000,000 colones [CRC] to buy wood, corrugated metal, and other materials to be able to finish.

With this loan he hopes to resolve the problem and live better.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate his home

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 40, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Avelina operates a recycling shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to recycling shops for a little profit. These shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every day.  Avenlina also has a piggery for additional income. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Avenlina is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will be incorporating this loan to her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Avelina dreams that her business will flourish and her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy recycled materials to resell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
This is Nora, 43, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Fernandez, an electrician, and is mother to her children.  She and her husband are managing their household as they operate a business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income to their family.

Nora operates an Internet café business. Services like this become a need as customer demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the Net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Norais requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business.

Nora hopes to expand her business and that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy computer accessories

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married, with four children. She is 47 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines.

To earn a living, Fe sells a variety of products and she has had this business for nine years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to purchase additional products, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, and soap. Fe has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. 

In the future, Fe hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is applying for a loan of $1200 to improve her business. She is single and is running a business in a market selling shirts, pants, short-sleeve and long-sleeve clothing. She is making a good income from selling and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. 

Modesta lives in a town near by the main road so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. Modesta opened her second-hand clothes business a year ago with her working capital of $600.  She is happy with this loan because it is helping to improve her living condition for the future.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam  es una madre emprendedora y uno de sus mayores logros ha sido la construcción de su vivienda , con el apoyo de su esposo ha logrado casi terminarla sin embargo aún le falta varios detalles ,necesita terminar los baños, cielo raso y construir las aceras, etc, necesita un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) con este dinero comprará los materiales necesarios para concluir los trabajos que hacen falta.
texts.en:
Miriam's an enterprising mother.  One of her biggest accomplishments has been building her home.  With her husband's support she has almost managed to finish, but several details are lacking.  She needs to finish the bathrooms, the ceiling, the sidewalks, etc.

She needs a loan for 1,000,000 colones [CRC] to buy the materials she needs to finish the work.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She is married and has 10 children. 

Loreta is 53 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. She sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4000 doing this type of work. 

Loreta has requested a loan for PHP 12000 to purchase additional inventories for her store business.  She hopes to live a comfortable life with her children all finished with their studies.























 www.indypressny.org

loans.use: buy inventories for her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a new member of PMPC. She applied for membership for the financial assistance that the cooperative can extend, especially for her store. 

Lorna is 49 years old, divorced and has 4 children.  She lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines.

Lorna  is a farmer and grows  fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer.

In the future, Lorna hopes to improve and expand her vegetable garden.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen signed up to be a member of PMPC recently. She is from Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines. Belen is 53 and is married with 4 children. 

Belen sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1900 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 6000 to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

In the future, Belen hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: buy products to sell

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, su ingreso es único en el hogar, trabaja fuertemente para alcanzar sus metas, se dedica a la confección de cortinas y  prendas de vestir, por lo cual solicita un crédito de quinientos cincuenta mil colones exactos (¢550.000)con este dinero comprará telas, hilos y otros accesorios necesarios para realizar su trabajo, ella agradece la oportunidad del financiamiento comunal pues con este apoyo puede cumplir con las metas propuestas
texts.en:
Sonia's the mother of two young children.  Her income is the only one in the household.  She works hard to achieve her goals.

Sonia earns a living making curtains and clothing.  She's requesting a loan for 550,000 colones [CRC] to buy the fabric, thread, and accessories she needs to do her job.

She's grateful for the opportunity to get communal bank financing because with this support she can achieve her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy fabric and accessories

loans.name: Noneta

texts.en:
Noneta works hard to support her family.   She is married and has a rock salt business in the Philippines.

Noneta requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rock salt to sell.  She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Noneta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy rock salt to resell

loans.name: Wynie

texts.en:
Wynie is 50 years old.  She is married and has two children who are in school.

Wynie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Wynie has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Wynie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 42 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, Adelia works very hard to provide for them.

Adelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Adelia has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, laundry soap, bath soap, noodles, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Adelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 62 years old.  She is married and has seven children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Consolacion has borrowed and repaid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an additional income from farming sugarcane.

Consolacion aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old, married and has two children. 

Evelyn is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Evelyn has been in this business for 14 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.   Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 37 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Fe has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, noodles, bread, cream, milk, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, noodles, spices, etc. for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has managed her general store for ten months now, earning about PHP 6,000 each month. She is grateful because through her husband's support and hard work, she is able to sustain her family's basic necessities.

Joyce would like to increase the grocery items she offers and so is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase cooking oil, canned goods, assorted biscuits, etc.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, canned goods, assorted biscuits, etc. to offer in her general store.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 43 года,замужем, имеет 3 совершеннолетних детей. Все дети студенты. Супруг работает учителем физкультуры в местной школе, а также помогает по бизнесу. Венера имеет средне-специальное образование. Венера работает библиотекарем в местной школе. Очень преданна своей работе, школьники очень уважают и любят ее. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1998 году Венера начала свой бизнес в откорме скота и полеводстве. Стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Венеры имеется: 1 дойная корова и 10 овец. Также имеет земельный надел размером 1,75 ГА, где в основном выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и селитры для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена женить сына.
texts.en: Venera is 43, married, and has three adult children who are all in school. Her spouse is a physical education teacher at the local school and also helps out with the family's farming business. Venera has a high school education and is the librarian at the local school. She is very dedicated to her work and the students love and respect her. In order to earn additional income for her family, Venera began raising cattle and planting crops in 1998. She started the farm with 10,000 som (KGS) and now earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Venera has one dairy cow and ten sheep on her farm, as well as 1.75 hectares of land where she plants beans and perennial grasses. In order to expand her business, Venera asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som to purchase mineral fertilizers. With the income from the loan, Venera plans to continue to develop her business and pay for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: El señor Santiago es una persona humilde,  de escasos recursos económicos,  su principal actividad económica es la producción de papa este año sus cultivos han sufrido un daño por  las intensas heladas presentados a principios del mes de junio, donde la producción de papa que se encontraba en desarrollo vegetativo a quedado totalmente seca sin opción a producir por lo menos  para recuperar la inversión, por las razones descritas don Santiago ha decidido realizar otra siembra del cultivo de papa en el mes de agosto donde las heladas ya culminan y el riesgo por presencia de las heladas desaparece, para realizar la actividad mencionada solicitó un préstamo donde el destino del crédito sea exclusivo para la compra de semilla de papa y agroquímicos que le garanticen una buena producción. Con los ingresos obtenidos cubrirá la educación de 5 hijos dependientes en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Santiago's a modest person of limited economic resources.  His main job is growing potatoes.

This year his crops were damaged because of intense freezes at the beginning of June, when potato production was in its vegetative state of development.  It dried up completely, without any possibility of producing even enough to recover his investment.  

For these reasons Santiago decided to do another potato planting in August when the freezes are over and the risk has disappeared.  To achieve this he requested a loan to buy potato seed and agrochemicals to guarantee a good crop.

The income he receives will cover the education costs of his five dependent school-age children.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and agrochemicals

loans.name: Dayanna Alexandra

texts.es:
El  interés de Dayanna por esta carrera surgió a raíz de la materia de Artes Plásticas en el colegio en la que hizo planchas en perspectiva a color o a blanco y negro, al ir pasando de año en la materia de informática le dieron un curso de Scratch donde debía crear un comercial con los personajes de este programa, la idea termino siendo una excelente presentación, Dayanna siguió interesándose cada vez más en la publicidad y lo aplico cuando en la materia de economía y política debía crear una empresa con sus compañeros y se encargo de crear y diseñar la imagen, el nombre, la pancarta, folletos, volantes para vender su producto (panelitas de leche).
Al entrar al grado décimo empezó clases de Ciencias y tecnología, Diseño Gráfico y Medios Audiovisuales, donde aprendió a diseñar páginas web, comienzos de la fotografía, alto y bajo relieve, volumen y sombra de objetos.
La meta de Dayanna a corto plazo es ingresar a su institución para adquirir más conocimiento que la lleven a hacer una gran carrera.
A  mediano plazo Dayanna estará graduada de  Técnico Profesional en Arte Gráfico  y Publicitario y estará  trabajando en una empresa donde pueda poner en práctica su carrera y así seguir ayudando a sus padres y hermanas. 
A largo plazo  Dayanna colocara su propia empresa de publicidad para ofrecer oportunidad de trabajo a jóvenes que tengan el mismo interés por la publicidad para que puedan costearse su carrera siendo jóvenes.
Y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo se comprara su casa, su carro, seguirá la profesional, y realizara una maestría. 
Gracias.
texts.en:
Dayanna’s interest in this career began while studying Visual Arts in high school, where she made perspective drawings in colour and black and white. The following year in IT she took a Scratch course where she had to create an advertisement with the characters from that program. Her idea ended up being an excellent presentation and Dayanna became more and more interested in advertising. She used her ideas in her Economics and Politics classes when she had to create a business with her classmates by taking charge of the creation and design of the logo, name, placard, brochures and flyers to sell their product (caramels).

When she started Year 10 she took classes in Science, Technology, Graphic Design and Audiovisual Media where she learnt how to design web pages and began studies in photography, bas relief and high relief, volume and shadow in objects. 

Dayanna’s short term goal is to enrol in an institution where she can gain better knowledge that will lead her to a great career.

Her medium term goal is to graduate from a vocational college in Graphic Design and Advertising and to be working in a company where she can put her studies into practice and continue helping her parents and her sisters.

Dayanna’s long term goal is to set up her own advertising company to offer employment opportunities to young people who have the same interest in advertising so that they can fund their studies while they are young. With the fruits of her labour she will buy a house and a car, continue in her profession and obtain a Master’s degree. 

Thank you.

loans.use: to obtain an education in graphic design and advertising at Corporación Las Mercedes  vocational college

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Noeun (in the photo) is 42 years old. He sells rice noodles for Khmer noodles, or Num Banh Chok. It is a complicated process that is very labor-intensive but produces delicious noodles. He buys Num Banh Chok from a nearby village and transports them to the Phnom Penh market. 

Noeun has been married since 1992 and has two young sons. He lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Noeun is asking for a loan to repair the house where he lives and to replace a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives and replace a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Gilberto
