texts.es: Don Gilberto de 53 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus hijos, él se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Gilberto es un hombre  increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajador y responsable, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas lo prefieren. Tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día lo prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, agujas, etc.  para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Gilberto is 53 years old and lives in his own home with his children. He earns his living by making and selling clothes. His business is located in his house. Gilberto is an incredible and exemplary man who is hardworking and responsible. In addition, many people have provided good references that attest to his character and his work.

Gilberto makes a variety of clothes at very affordable prices. There is also quality in his work, which is why many people prefer to do business with him. He has been in this business for 30 years and has a great deal of experience, but most of all, his established customers appreciate him more each day.

Gilberto has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can invest in his small business. He will buy needed supplies such as fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons, needles, and other items for making a variety of clothes. Everything he does is intended to provide better service to his customers so that they will be motivated to continue seeking his services. As a result, his sales and earnings will increase. He hopes to achieve his goal and improve his quality of life and that of his children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, buttons, needles, and other items.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Eduardo y de su pequeño hijo. 
Marleni se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas del cultivo ayudando en la labor a sus padres, luego cuando formo su propia familia empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo. Comenta que la labor de campo es muy sacrificada, pues siembra papa y alverja en sus chacras propias, y debe vigilar sus cultivos todos los días desde muy temprano, para cuidarlos de las plagas y las inclemencias del tiempo que muchas veces afectan y atacan a sus cultivos. Ahora se encuentra sola en esta labor, ya que su esposo comenzó a trabajar como peón en la fabricación de una hidroeléctrica. Lo que le disgusta es cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales, para llevarlos a comercializar hasta los mercados de la ciudad. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida del apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Marleni, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marleni, 28, lives in her own house with her husband Eduardo and her young son.

Marleni earns a living in agriculture.  She learned growing techniques helping her parents.  Later, when she started her own family, she began to work with her husband.  She says farm work is very demanding.  She grows potatoes and peas on her own farm, and she has to look after her crops every day from an early hour to protect them from pests and inclement weather, which often affect and attack the crops.

Now she works alone because her husband started working as a day laborer building a hydroelectric station.  What she doesn't like is carrying the heavy sacks of natural products to sell in the markets in the city.

This is her fourth Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial help so she can get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

Marleni will invest the 2500 soles in organic soil amendments to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Juan y con 5 de sus 7 hijos, pues los dos mayores trabajan independientemente. Basilia se dedica a la agricultura, siembra junto a su esposo papa, alverjas, maíz y flores de gladiolo y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado, durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha, mientras cuida a sus animales como: vacas, toros, ovejas y cerdos. Y cuando llega el tiempo para recoger toda su buena producción observa la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo, y carga junto a sus familiares los pesados sacos con los productos naturales que vende a precios mayoristas en la ciudad. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Basilia, invertirá S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, lives in her own house with her husband Juan and five of her seven children, because the two oldest work on their own.

Basilia earns a living in agriculture.  She and her husband grow potatoes, peas, corn, and gladiolus.  She affirms that she's very dedicated to her work.  Every day she looks after her fields patiently until the harvest, while taking care of her cows, bulls, sheep, and pigs.  When the time comes to harvest her good crop she sees the reward for all her effort, and she and her family carry the heavy sacks with the natural crops they sell at wholesale prices in the city.

This is her fourth Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial help so she can get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

Basilia will invest 2000 soles [PEN] in organic soil amendments to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Marilen

texts.es: Marilen, habitante del barrio llamado Villa Venezuela, una zona marginal de Managua, es madre de una niña de tres años, su esposo le ayuda en todo, se desempeña como conductor, ella se dedica a vender cosméticos, para el cual está solicitando el crédito para invertirle más productos como perfumes para damas y caballeros ya que tiene pocos en existencia para ofrecer a sus clientes, también desea experimentar comprando una paca para niño y venderlo, con esto ella busca como salir adelante junto a su pequeña familia y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Marilen resides in the neighborhood called Villa Venezuela, a marginalized section of Managua. She is the mother of a three-year-old daughter. Her husband helps her with everything and works as a driver.

Marilen sells cosmetics. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in more products, such as perfumes for women and men, since she currently has little inventory to offer to her customers. In addition, she wants to experiment by purchasing a bundle of children’s clothing to sell in hopes that this will help her small family get ahead and enable her to assist her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and a bundle of children's clothing.

loans.name: Samaraddin

texts.ru: Самараддину 18 лет. Он добродушный и целеустремленный молодой человек. Самараддин в 2002 году пошёл в школу. Он учился в школе успешно и активно участвовал во всех внеклассных мероприятиях школы. Самараддин окончил школу с отличными оценками в 2013 году и поступил в Технический Университет Таджикистана. Он будет учиться по специальности инженера. Самараддин должен оплатить за учебный договор и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Samaraddin is 18 years old.  He is a good-natured and determined young man.  He started attending school in 2002.  He was successful in his studies and actively participated in all the school's extracurricular activities.  Samaraddin graduated high school with excellent grades in 2013 and began studying at the Technical University of Tajikistan to become an engineer.  He must pay his tuition and is asking for a loan of 800 USD to do so.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his education at the university

loans.name: German Aldo

texts.es: El Sr. Germán tiene 27 años, el se dedica a la venta de pollo al espiedo en su pensión se encuentra en un de las calles concurridas de la zona de Plan 3000,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Germán va a usar este préstamo para compra de casetas  para expandir la venta de sus pollos al espiedo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra esta herramienta útil para su negocio,  El Sr. Germán enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida rápida y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes, El Sr. Germán es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Germán, 27, earns a living selling rotisserie chicken in his food stall located on one of the busy streets in the Plan 3000 area.

This is Germán's second loan sequence with the institution.  He's going to use it to buy a stand to expand his sales of rotisserie chicken.  He's requesting this loan because he lacks the cash to buy this useful tool for his business.  He's going to use his profits to buy utensils and to expand his stall to attract more customers.

The challenges Germán faces in his business are the weather and competition with other fast food businesses.

Germán's a very hardworking person.  He's happy for the opportunity to be granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stand to sell rotisserie chicken

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейну 19 лет. Он студент 1 курса. Хусейн учится в Университет Бизнеса и службы. Хусейн учится отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Его учителя гордятся Хусейном, и его однокурсники очень любят его. Хусейн учит упорно для того, чтобы получить хорошее образование и в будущем стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Он еще не женат и живет с родителями. Хусейн не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор. С такой целью он обратился за займом. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Huseyn is 19 years old.  He's a freshman studying at the University of Business and Services.  He receives the highest marks and  actively participates in the public life of the school.  His professors take pride in Huseyn and his classmates love him very much.  He studies hard in order to receive a good education and to, in the future, become a highly qualified specialist.  He is not yet married and he lives with his parents.  Huseyn cannot pay his tution, so he's taking out a loan to cover his expenses.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Karen Yanina

texts.es:
La señora  Karen Yanina de 33  años de edad es casada, tiene tres hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 09 Años  a la venta de ropa y calzado para toda las edades.
Doña Karen Yanina sus ventas las realiza desde su casa y de forma ambulante.
Doña Karen Yanina está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blusas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, camisas, calzonetas, zapatos, etc.  Y también necesita el préstamo para compra de carnes ya que ella hace hamburguesas y tacos para vender.
Doña Karen Yanina  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y surtir mas su negocio, su sueño es ampliar el negocio y construir su casa.

San Lorenzo, honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. Karen Yanina is 33 years old, married, and has three dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, Valle in southern Honduras. Karen does not own a home and has been selling clothes and shoes for all ages for the past nine years. She conducts her sales from home and as a traveling vendor.

Doña Karen Yanina is requesting a loan in order to buy blouses, dresses, trousers, skirts, shirts, swimsuits, shoes, and other items. In addition, she needs the loan in order to buy meat for making hamburgers and tacos that she can sell.

With the support of this loan, Doña Karen Yanina intends to improve her earnings and restock her business. Her dream is to expand her business and build a house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, trousers, skirts, shirts, swimsuits, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia works hard to support her family. Inocencia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Inocencia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Inocencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 58 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a loan of PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Juanita has been in this business for 15 years. Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell firewood and charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell.

Lita has been in this business for 12 years. She also earns more income from raising pigs.

Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a small kitchen and serve more customers.

loans.name: Ma. Jaquiline

texts.en:
Ma. Jaquiline is 34 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jaquiline has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional goods like candies, biscuits, bread, detergent soap and cooking oil to sell in her general store.

Ma. Jaquiline has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like candies, biscuits, bread, detergent soap and cooking oil to sell in her general store

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique has been operating his business, EGY Maquinados and Diseños Industries, LLC for more than one year.  He specializes in manufacturing knobs and screws.  Based in Eagle Pass, Texas, he uses a specialized machine to create many different knobs and screws to sell.

Enrique visited the Small Business Development Center in Eagle Pass and was referred to Accion Texas Inc. for a business loan.  He applied for a microloan and received it once his application was reviewed and approved.

He used his loan to purchase additional machinery to generate more revenue by producing more knobs and screws to sell.  Enrique said, “it would take me longer to save up money to purchase a machine.”  The loan allowed Enrique to buy what he needed and keep his one full-time employee too.

Enrique continues to operate his business and keep his one employee.  He does not plan to hire more at this time, but says he is happy he has what he needs to continue his business and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional machinery to generate more revenue by producing more knobs and screws to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase required insurance and create a secure home to set up her business of caring for others

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim, a villager from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, is a rice grower on three hectares of farmland. She is married and has five children. 

Her current business, which is the a sole business for her entire family, has enabled her to up to 35,000 KHR per day. From this income portion, she manages to save up to 18,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first time Lim has borrowed from VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her last loan with success and it has help support her business. 

For this new cycle, she forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR whereas her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pay for the plowing fee as well as the transplanting fee. She hopes to make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Fredis Alberto

texts.es:
Fredis es originario de la linda ciudad de Estelí conocida popularmente como el diamante de las Segovia. Fredis se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos valores morales, su estado civil es casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ya es su segundo crédito que trabaja con ceprodel y manifiesta que con el primero fue de gran impacto ya que ha realizado mejora en su vivienda.

Su oficio es fontanero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace siete años afirma que este oficio lo aprendió desde hace más de doce años y que ha sido de gran experiencia por que el comenzó como ayudante y ahora le ha enseñado a otros compañeros.

Con el monto otorgado lo va destinar para compra de materiales de construcción: arena , hierro, cemento y ladrillo ya que va construir una habitación en su casa ya que sus hijos van en crecimiento y van a necesitar tener su propia habitaciones. A la misma vez agradece a kiva por este apoyo por que así podrá dar mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fredis is originally from the beautiful city of Estelí, which is popularly known as the Diamond of Segovia. He is known for being a person of good moral values. Fredis is married and has two children who are of school age. This is the second loan he has received from CEPRODEL and he says that his first loan had a great impact on improving his home.

Fredis works as a plumber for a water and sewage service company. He says that he has been in this job for seven years and learned the trade more than 12 years ago. Fredis gained a great deal of experience when he started out as an assistant. Now he teaches his other co-workers.

The amount he requested will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, iron, cement, and bricks for building a room in his house. His children are growing and will need to have their own rooms. Fredis is grateful to Kiva for this support because it will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy sand, iron, cement, and bricks for building a room in his house.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Sam Ath, age 45, buys and sells vegetable. She has been married since 1990 and has one daughter who is in university. 

Her husband is a chef for weddings. She lives with her elderly mother in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sam Ath is requesting a loan to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house. With a concrete brick room that she will build with money from the loan, it will be a good place for Sam Ath to keep things.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: La Sra. Ana  Maria sigue con la actividad de la venta de material escolar y material de escritorio en su librería que se encuentra en la zona de Alto Pampahasi cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de variedad de productos para surtir su librería creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de material escolar por mayor para seguir incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Ana María continues with her job selling school and paper supplies in her bookstore in the Alto Pampahasi area.  She says the previous loan went well for her because she used it to buy a variety of products to stock her bookstore.  She expanded her business and increased her clientele and, as a result, her income.

Currently she's requesting a loan to buy school supplies wholesale and continue increasing her working capital.

She's happy about and grateful for this new opportunity she's being offered.

loans.use: to buy school supplies wholesale

loans.name: German Mauricio

texts.es: Germán de 32 años de edad,se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa de sus padres y sus hermanos los cuales le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura, Germán esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc.  y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Germán is 32 years old and has been farming for several years. His main crops are corn and beans, which are sold to the brokers who buy and sell basic grains near his place of residence. The profit he generates from his sales helps with the family expenses. Germán lives at home with his parents and siblings, who help with the farm work.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies that will help with the planting of his crops such as compost, seeds, fertilizers, and other items. As a result, he will achieve better earnings and be able to continue helping with the household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, and other items.

loans.name: Iván Darío

texts.es: Iván es un joven de 18 años de edad, soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Luego de haber terminado su educación secundaria, se dedicó a las labores del campo, actividad que aprendió de su padre y su hermano mayor. Actualmente posee un cultivo de aguacate con aproximadamente 70 matas de este fruto, pues su padre le cedió un pequeño lote para que él lo trabajara y obtuviera recursos por su propia cuenta. Iván es un joven emprendedor, pujante, con ganas de salir adelante, por esta razón solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fungicidas, pesticidas, fertilizantes y semillas de fríjol), esto le permitirá continuar con su negocio y cosechar productos con buena calidad para venderlos a un mejor precio y, además podrá sembrar un cultivo de fríjol en un pequeño terreno, con lo cual tendrá otra variedad de producto para vender, obteniendo como resultado un incremento en sus ingresos. De esta forma Iván sueña seguir avanzando para llegar a tener un cultivo más productivo, que le brinde una estabilidad económica para aportar con el sostenimiento y el sustento diario de sus padres y tener la posibilidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de todos.
texts.en:
Iván, 18, is single and doesn't have children yet.  After finishing secondary school he worked in the fields, which he learned from his father and his older brother.  Currently he has an avocado crop with approximately 70 avocado plants.  His father gave him a small plot of land to farm and earn his own resources.

Iván's an enterprising and thriving young man who wants to get ahead, so he's requesting the support of a loan to invest in buying agricultural inputs (soil amendments, fungicide, pesticide, fertilizer, and bean seed).  This will allow him to continue with his business and harvest a quality crop to sell for a better price.  He'll also be able to plant a crop of beans on a small plot of land so he has another crop to sell, increasing his income as a result.

Iván dreams of continuing to make progress so he'll have a more productive crop.  This will give him the economic stability to help support his parents and to have the possibility of improving everyone's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Sreng's Group

texts.en:
Sreng is a mother of seven children and in mid 40s. She is farmer who does rice cropping with the support of her husband, as the primary source of her income. This income supports especially her two dependent kids. 

Besides this agribusiness, she and her husband also work for others for a fee. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 18,000 KHR per day. 

For Sreng, who is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she forms a group of five to seek a loan, which it is the first loan for her. Sreng and three fellow group members are seeking for the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each, while the remaining member is applying for 600,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to increase her income and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three kids in school, Koeurn is 33 years old and married. Her main source of income is from cassava farming and rice cropping. She is able to generate about 18,100 KHR per day and save up to 7,000 after deducting necessary expenses. 

Koeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles, which she has repaid back completely. She has utilized her past loan wisely to relieve her family’s burden and keep her kids in school. 

She is now leading a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for the weeding fee and the reaping fee. 

She hopes that she can support her business on time and make a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for the weeding fee and reaping fee

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Rom is a mother of four schoolchildren. She is 32 years old and a farmer who strives for a living via cassava farming, rice cropping, and rubber tree planting. She has involved in current business for 15 years. 

Rom has never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. For Rom, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for the plowing fee and the reaping fee. 

She hopes to make more income so that she can expand her crop farming to a bigger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for the plowing fee and the reaping fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an oven to make bread.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn is 46 years old and a mother of one child who is in school. She and the rest of her family live in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She raises her family as a widow by farming rice on one hectare of farmland, selling porridge and Chinese noodles, and raising pigs. She has been in her current business for ten years, and she is able to earn up to 34,100 Cambodien Riel (KHR) per day. 

Khorn is a seven-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which she used wisely to better support her business as well as her living. Now, she joins a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more pigs and feed. She hopes this purchase will enlarge her pig-raising business and return a good income.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and feed.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: A mother of eight children, one of whom is in school, Oun is a villager from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, where cassava is one of the well-known products in the area. Besides farming cassava on one and a half hectare, which is her primary source of income, she grows rice on another half-hectare area.  She struggles to make a living as a widow who currently is in her early 50s. She is able to earn up to 28,600 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is the second microloan borrower who has repaid her original loan with success and improved her lifestyle from what it was. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy potash for her farmland and pay a fee for plowing, to be ready for planting season. She hopes that she can increase her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland and pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Mercedita has requested a loan of 23,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items such as toothpaste, shampoo, coffee, candies, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store.

Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of products like toothpaste, shampoo, coffee, candies, cooking oil, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for herself and her husband.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, seasonings, snack foods, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries. Marilou has requested a loan of 27,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 57 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposa Dionicia y con el menor de sus 7 hijos. Manuel se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, recuerda como los miembros de su localidad se ayudaban mutualmente en sus chacras, y por eso sabe que trabajando en equipo las cosas salen mejor. En  la actualidad siembra papa y alverjas en sus terrenos de cultivo junto a sus hijos mayores quienes trabajan con el para poder mantener a sus hijos. Como cuenta con este apoyo no necesita de trabajadores del lugar, además dice que gracias al trabajo agrícola ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y por eso lo considera un trabajo rentable, aunque no siempre obtiene una buena producción, por las plagas o el clima, dice que siempre se gana algo de dinero de la comercialización con los mayoristas de la ciudad. Además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, que vende cuando se le presenta alguna dificultad. Y como es un hombre emprendedor tiene planeado comprar más vacas pues quiere ampliar este negocio. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Manuel, invertirá los S/.1700 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Manuel, age 57, lives in his own house, in the company of his wife Dionicia and with the youngest of his 7 children. Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He remembers how the inhabitants of his area helped each other on their farms, and thus he knows that working as a team leads to better results. Currently, he grows potatoes and peas on his farmland, together with his older children who work with him to support their children. Since he has this support, he does not need laborers from the area. In addition, he says that thanks to this agricultural work, he has been able to help his children get ahead, and thus he considers it profitable work. Although he does not always obtain a good harvest, due to pests or the weather, he says that he always earns some money by selling to the wholesalers in the city. He also works raising cattle, which he sells whenever he faces some kind of difficulty. And since he is an enterprising man, he plans to buy more cattle, since he would like to expand this business. This is his fourth loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful about receiving financial support that allows him to continue making progress. He is also committed to making his payments in a punctual manner. Manuel will invest the 1700 soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en: Met, 39, is a married mother of four children. These days, only three of her children are dependent on her, as two of them are in school. The remaining one is still too young for schooling. Met's main source of income is rice farming, though she and her husband also work for others for a fee to supplement their income. She has been involved in her current business for ages and it has returned her about 8,800 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. Met, who is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading her first microloan group, consisting of three female members, to seek a new loan. Met will spend her loan portion, 500,000 KHR, in order to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to boost her crop yield and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is 48 years old and is happily married to Willie, who works as a broker. God has blessed them with loving children. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God they were able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Rosa owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and is connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5 Philippine pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosa gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community. She earns 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, Rosa is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help as she adds more products to her store.

Rosa hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, such as toiletries and beverages, needed in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 60 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Margarita has a livestock business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock. 

Margarita has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Banco Mujer Visión Group

texts.es: Esmeralda es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Visión, un grupo de mujeres indígenas de la zonas de Talamanca, compuesto por 9 socias que se dedican al comercio y la agricultura. Doña Esmeralda es madre soltera y jefa de hogar, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad.  Está mujer tan trabajadora es comerciante de forma ambulante, vende ropa, perfumes, cosméticos y productos de catálogos, y los ingresos generados por ese negocio son los que le permiten cubrir todos los gastos familiares, reinvertir y pagar el préstamo. Ella ha recibido 3 préstamos anteriormente y han sido de mucha ayuda para ella y sus hijos. Esta nueva inversión será para mercadería como sandalias ropa y otros productos que tiene encargados. Su meta más importante es darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños, así como incrementar sus ventas extendiéndose a otras comunidades cercanas.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is the president of “Banco Mujer Visión”, a group that consists of nine indigenous women from the districts of Talamanca. These women engage in trade and agriculture.

Doña Esmeralda is a single mother and the head of her household. She has two young children. This hardworking woman is a traveling merchant who sells clothing, perfumes, cosmetics, and other products through catalogs. The income she generates from this business enables her to cover all of her family expenses, reinvest, and repay her loan. She has received three previous loans, which were a great help to her and her children.

This new investment will be used to buy merchandise such as sandals, clothing, and other products for which she has orders. Her most important goal is to provide a better quality of life for her little ones, but she also wants to increase her sales by expanding into other communities nearby.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sandals, perfumes, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Voleak's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Voleak is 41 years old and makes a living to support her children through cassava farming and trading rubber tree seedlings. She has been involved in this business since she was 20 years old. Voleak is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She joins a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,000,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more rubber tree seedlings to resell. She hopes to earn more income from both of her businesses so she can buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rubber tree seedlings to resell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the ingredients needed in her food stall. Her income from her business also helped in the family's everyday expenses. She also has a variety store, for additional income. As a widow, she works hard to provide for her family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 50,000, to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagro's dream is to be more successful in her business and she hopes to have a peaceful and happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 53 years old and has two children. She is married; both children are in school.

Merle is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Merle has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

Merle has been raising livestock for 15 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her  business.

Merle would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro nació en la ciudad de Juliaca pero vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata junto con su familia, él tiene 65 años de edad y es casado entonces fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, él es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como polos, bikinis, pantalones cortos y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Marticito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo y él cada treinta días sube de la ciudad de Pilcopata a Paucartambo para las reuniones de grupo.
texts.en:
Teodoro was born in Juliaca city but lives in Pilcopata city with his family. He is 65 years old, married, and has three children as fruit of this beautiful relationship. He is a hard-working and enterprising father who provides for his family with the efforts from his work. His main economic busienss is selling clothing for children, women and men and with this loan he wants to buy merchandise such as polos, swimsuits, shorts, and other items. He is thankful to those who are part of this dream through the loan and he promises to make his monthly payments responsibly.  

He belongs to the Communal Bank “San Marticito” in the Arariwa Association in Paucartambo city and every 30 days he goes from Pilcopata to Paucartambo for his group's meetings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as polos, swimsuits, shorts, and other items.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la ciudad mencionada, ella tiene 60 años de edad y  es viuda pero tiene seis hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo habas, trigo, cebada, maíz y otras cosas más por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos como maíz, trigo y otras cosas pues ella compra por mayor para luego llevar a la ciudad del Cusco y distribuirlos a las revendedoras de diferentes mercados, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Luzmila was born in Paucartambo city and lives there with her family. She is 60 years old, a widow, but has six children. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who supports her family with her work. She sells dried basic grains such as beans, wheat, barley, corn and others. She needs a loan in order to buy dried grains such as corn, wheat and others as she buys wholesale to later take to Cusco city and distribute them to resellers in different markets. She thanks those are part of this dream through their support of the loan and she promises to make her monthly payments responsibly. 

She belongs to the “San Martincito” Community Bank in the Arariwa Association in Paucartambo city.

loans.use: to buy dried grains such as corn and wheat.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 43 años, está casada con Eusebio y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Celia se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad y sus principales cultivos constan de alverja, papa y maíz; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde viaja después de cada cosecha. Gracias a la agricultura pudo obtener los 5 terrenos de cultivo que ahora posee, como también 2 toros de buena raza, con los cuales trabaja la tierra. “Nunca dejaré de sembrar, siempre mantendré la costumbre familiar”, comenta Celia. Pues para el futuro desea mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos. Este es su cuarto crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Celia, invertirá los S/.3500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Celia, age 43, is married to Eusebio and has three children.  She lives with them in her own house.  Celia is a farmer.  She has been engaged in this business activity for 20 years.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes, and corn.  She sells them for a good price at the wholesale market in her city, where she travels after each harvest.  

Thanks to farming, she was able to get the five pieces of crop land that she now has.  She also has two bulls, which are of a good breed, and she works the land with them.  “I will never stop planting; I will always keep the family ways,” Celia says.  In the future she wishes to improve the quality of her food.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support she is getting in order to get ahead.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  Celia will invest the 3,500 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 51 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like eggs, laundry soap, snack foods, soft-drinks, bread, cooking oil, etc., in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

Myrna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like eggs, laundry soap, snack foods, soft-drinks, bread, cooking oil, etc., in her general store.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, a 52-year-old responsible mother of six, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and children. Her husband is retired and receiving a pension which is not sufficient to meet the household expenses. Shahnaz's two sons are drivers who want to start their own business.

Shahnaz has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can purchase a rickshaw to operate. This will increase his monthly income and they will be able to continue sending their children to school.

Shahnaz is very hopeful about this loan and is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Miadeh

texts.en:
Miadeh is an Iraqi client, who is 33 years old, married and has four children. Miadeh and her husband assist each other in providing the family's income.

Miadeh is a tailor who works from home. She specializes in all types of women outfits. She gained her experience from her mother, who taught her when Miadeh was in her youth. Miadeh has been tailoring since 1996. She is well-known in the neighborhood, with an excellent reputation.

Miadeh is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy two new sewing machines to increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to keep assisting her husband in providing for their family's needs in a better way and to educate their children.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon buys and sells potatoes. She buys potatoes from farmers in her village and sells to a middleman who comes to buy them at her home. She also assists her husband in his farming business.  

Chuon hopes to continue her business by buying additional potatoes for resale. Hence, she has decided to apply for a loan in order to help her business.

loans.use: to buy additional potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Alexandra Esther

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 12, 8 y 4 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en  colegio y el siguiente en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. Hace tiempo atrás ella  estudio belleza e una Academia en Montecristi y obtuvo el título de artesana en belleza.

Doña Alexandra tiene un salón de belleza en su casa en el cual  realiza diversos trabajos como  tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre otras cosas. Además también vende productos de Esika, Lebel, Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ventas que realiza al mismo  tiempo que  realiza sus trabajos de belleza. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Lleva más de 9 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, tratamientos, esmaltes  y productos de Avon, Yanbal. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan siempre los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un gran salón de belleza en Manta.
texts.en:
The "1 De Agosto" ["August 1"] communal bank meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized on the national and international levels. It is the source of the famous hats made from paja toquilla fibers.

In this place lives Alexandra, who is 34 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has three children, aged 12, 8 and 4. The older one is in secondary school and the next one is in primary school. Her husband is a security guard. Some time ago. she studied beauty at an academy in Montecristi  and obtained a certificate in Beauty Artistry. 

Alexandra has a beauty salon in her home, where she offers diverse services such as haircuts and manicures, among others. She also sells products from Esika, Lebel, Yanbal and Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She makes these sales at the same time that she provides her beauty services. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m., and sometimes even later, when her customers need her services. She has operated her business for more than 9 years, and it is going quite well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy dyes, treatments, nail polish and Avon and Yanbal products. She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because of the help which the loans always provide for her. 

Her dream is to have a large beauty salon in the city of Manta.

loans.use: to buy dyes, treaments, nail polish, and Avon and Yanbal products.
